Increases fine for specified offenses; increases criminal penalty & revising applicability of criminal penalty for second offenses of specified violations occurring within specified time period; provides penalties for impeding, obstructing, or interfering with an emergency vehicle while participating in drag race, street takeover, stunt driving, competition, contest, test, or exhibition; increases penalty for third or subsequent offenses of specified violations occurring within specified time period; increases fine for such violations; increases fine for acting as spectator at specified violations.
Provides annual appropriation to DEP to implement Heartland Headwaters Protection & Sustainability Act; requires funds to be used & distributed for specified purposes.
Creates Forensic Investigative Genetic Genealogy Grant Program within FDLE; specifies potential recipients; provides purposes for grants; requires report from each recipient within certain timeframe.

bill_title: Comprehensive Waste Reduction and Recycling Plan
bill_desc: Requires DEP to develop comprehensive waste reduction & recycling plan by specified date, convene technical assistance group, & submit report to Legislature.

Provides for reduction in number of judges on 1st District Court of Appeal & 2nd District Court of Appeal upon occurrence of event that otherwise would have resulted in judicial vacancy; provides limitation on automatic reduction of judges; requires Chief Justice of Supreme Court to notify Governor & Legislature of occurrence of specified event.

bill_title: Declarations of a Public Health Emergency
bill_desc: Provides that administration of vaccines is not included within meaning of terms "treat," "treated," or "treatment" as they relate to public health emergencies; revises provisions related to expiration & renewal of declarations of public health emergency; authorizes individual to refuse examination, testing, or treatment under State Health Officer's order during public health emergency by submitting written refusal to State Health Officer; requires due process on case-by-case basis to allow actions that affect entire groups or communities.
Requires that woman who has recently given birth be excused from certain jury service under specified conditions.

bill_title: Lights Displayed on Fire Department Vehicles
bill_desc: Authorizes certain government-owned fire department vehicles to show or display blue lights.

Requires public postsecondary educational institutions to report certain student information to U.S. Department of Homeland Security; requires FCS institutions & state universities to assess out-of-state fee for students who promote foreign terrorist organization; & provides that students who promote foreign terrorist organization are ineligible for specified fee waivers & any institutional or state grants, financial aid, scholarships, or tuition assistance.
Urges U.S. Secretary of State to implement policies that reinstate economic sanctions on Nicolăs Maduro & his Venezuelan dictatorship & impose sanctions on companies that do business with Venezuela.
Provides that private counsel retained by victim of sexual offense may be present during victim depositions.
Specifies methodology by which certain timeshare units must be valued in certain tax appeals; provides that methodology meets constitutional mandate for just valuation.

Provides that county, municipality, other political subdivision of state, commercial entity, or third-party agent that complies with certain requirements is not liable in connection with cybersecurity incident.

bill_title: Temporary Sales Tax Exemption for Items Related to Electric Transportation
bill_desc: Provides sales tax exemption during a specified period on retail sale of certain items related to electric transportation.

bill_title: Universal Free School Breakfast and Lunch Program
bill_desc: Requires DACS to establish & operate universal free school breakfast & lunch program for public school students; provides program requirements & authorization for school districts.

Authorizes local governments to adopt alternative mobility plan & fee system; provides requirements for application of adopted alternative system; prohibits alternative system from imposing responsibility for funding existing transportation deficiency upon new development; prohibits local governments that do not issue building permits from charging for transportation impacts associated with development; requires local governments that issue building permits to collect for extrajurisdictional impacts; prohibits local governments from assessing multiple charges for same transportation impact; revises requirements for calculation of impact fees by local governments & special districts.

bill_title: Building Construction Regulations and System Warranties
bill_desc: Provides specified effective date for provisions relating to HVAC manufacturer's warranty transfers; prohibits HVAC manufacturer's warranties from being conditioned upon product registration; provides effective date for certain HVAC systems & components warranties under specified circumstance; provides required information for warranty & product registration cards & forms; prohibits HVAC systems & components warranties from being conditioned upon product registration.
Establishes Artificial Intelligence in Education Task Force within DOE; provides requirements for such task force.

bill_title: Return of Weapons and Arms Following an Arrest
bill_desc: Requires weapons, electric weapons or devices, or arms taken from person pursuant to arrest that are not seized as evidence be returned to person from whom they were taken if specified conditions are met; authorizes development of procedures for returns; prohibits sheriff or chief of police from requiring court order.
Revises timeframes within which law enforcement officers must provide certain notices to owners of certain abandoned or lost properties.

bill_title: Unlawful Possession of Firearms or Weapons by a Person Adjudicated Delinquent
bill_desc: Provides that person must have been adjudicated delinquent for an action committed as juvenile to cause person to lose right to possess firearm for specified period.

bill_title: Access to Appropriate Medications for Serious Mental Illness
bill_desc: Requires AHCA to approve drug products for Medicaid recipients for treatment of serious mental illness without step-therapy prior authorization; directs agency to include rate impact of this act in certain program rates that become effective on specified date.

Authorizes registered pharmacy technicians to dispense medicinal drugs under certain circumstances; defines terms "supervising pharmacist" & "supervising pharmacy"; provides requirements for remote-site pharmacies; exempts registered pharmacists serving as prescription department managers for remote-site pharmacies from certain practice limitations.

bill_title: Prohibition of Smoking and Vaping in State Parks
bill_desc: Prohibits smoking & vaping within boundaries of state parks; requires DOH to post specified signs; provides penalties.

Requires board, or DBPR when there is no board, to allow by rule that distance learning may be used to satisfy continuing education requirements; revises requirements that such continuing education must satisfy; requires board or DBPR to exempt certain individuals from completing their continuing education requirement.

Requires certain hospitals to administer congenital cytomegalovirus screenings on newborns admitted to hospital under specified circumstances; provides coverage under Medicaid program for screenings & any medically necessary follow-up reevaluations; requires newborns diagnosed with congenital cytomegalovirus be referred to primary care physician for medical management, treatment, & follow-up services.
Changes name of "Tallahassee Community College" to "Tallahassee State College".

bill_title: Limitation on Local Fees for Virtual Offices
bill_desc: Prohibits county, municipality, or local governmental entity from imposing, levying, or collecting certain fees relating to utilization of virtual office.

Revises tax collector base salaries; defines "tax collector employee"; provides that tax collector employees are eligible to receive certain adoption benefits; specifies monetary benefit amounts to be paid under specified conditions; requires such employees to apply to DCF to obtain benefit; authorizes DCF to adopt specified rules; authorizes county tax collectors to budget for & pay hiring & retention bonuses to employees under specified conditions; authorizes district school board to contract with county tax collector to authorize tax collector employee to administer road tests on school grounds at one or more secondary schools within district.

Requires DVA, subject to appropriation, to expand programs connecting veterans & their families & survivors to certain services, benefits, & support; requires DVA to host public events for such purpose; requires report to Governor & Legislature.

bill_title: Collier Mosquito Control District, Collier County
bill_desc: Amends district boundaries.
Requires institution of higher education to waive certain examination requirements for servicemember who applies for admission to graduate program that requires such examination.
Revises definition of term "registered mail" for purposes of construction of Florida Statutes; defines "return receipt requested" for purposes of construction of Florida Statutes.

Authorizes financial institutions to delay disbursement or transaction from account of specified adult; requires financial institution to make certain information available upon request by certain entities; specifies that delay on disbursement or transaction expires on certain date; authorizes financial institution to extend delay; authorizes court of competent jurisdiction to shorten or extend delay; requires financial institutions to take certain actions before placing delay on disbursement or transaction.
Urges Congress to support solutions that examine pollution differential between United States production & other countries & that hold foreign polluters accountable for their pollution.

Requires FDLE to contract with private provider to supply statewide reporting system to law enforcement agencies by specified date; requires secondhand dealers & pawnbrokers to electronically submit transactions to such system; authorizes sheriffs to supply computer equipment to certain secondhand dealers & pawnbrokers; revises requirements for remittance of payments by secondhand precious metals dealers.

bill_title: Equitable Distribution of Marital Assets and Liabilities
bill_desc: Requires court to consider certain factors when determining if extraordinary circumstances exist; provides certain actions do not change whether real property is marital property; provides that business interests in closely held business is marital asset; requires court to consider certain factors when determining value of such interest; provides that certain real property is nonmarital asset.

bill_title: Florida Seal of Fine Arts Program
bill_desc: Establishes Florida Seal of Fine Arts Program within DOE; provides purpose of program, eligibility criteria, & Commissioner of Education, DOE, & school district duties & responsibilities.

Revises the definitions of commercial & residential pool/spa contractors & swimming pool/spa servicing contractor; specifies maximum recovery amount for certain claims relating to certain contracts; specifies total aggregate cap for certain licensees relating to certain contracts.

Requires certain buffer zones for land or water delineations established by county or municipality to be acquired by county or municipality through eminent domain; preempts regulation of specified dredge & fill activities to state; repeals land management review teams.

bill_title: Pub. Rec./Photographs, Recordings, and Reports of Autopsies of Suicide Victims
bill_desc: Creates exemptions from public records requirements for photograph or video or audio recording of suicide of person & autopsy reports of suicide victims; requires that viewing, copying, listening to, or other handling of such photograph or video or audio recording or autopsy reports be under direct supervision of custodian of record or his or her designee; provides criminal penalties; provides for retroactive application; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemptions.

bill_title: Traveling Across County Lines to Commit Criminal Offenses
bill_desc: Provides for reclassification of certain offenses if person who commits offense travels with intent to commit offense in county other than person's county of residence.
Requires certain inmates to submit DNA samples.

Specifies nonelectric fence or wall must enclose outside perimeter of low-voltage electric fence; requires low-voltage electric fence to be specified number of feet above such nonelectric fence or wall; permitting low-voltage electric fences to be installed in areas within more than one zoning category; prohibits municipality, county, district, or other entity of local government from adopting or maintaining ordinances or rules that provide additional requirements for low-voltage alarm system projects.

Removes provisions providing for award of certificate of completion to certain students; & creates Music-based Supplemental Content to Accelerate Learner Engagement & Success Pilot Program within DOE for specified purpose.

Requires Division of Hotels & Restaurants to develop course for food managers that addresses issues surrounding food allergies & actions to assist; requires public food service establishments to post summaries in prominent places that address allergic reactions & appropriate actions to assist; provides specification for such summaries.
Requires law enforcement agencies to notify child care facilities of certain incidents at nearby schools.
Disqualifies persons from being elected or appointed to board of directors of banks.

bill_title: Florida High School Athletic Association Student Eligibility Requirements
bill_desc: Requires FHSAA to adopt bylaws prohibiting students who are sentenced as adults for specified offenses from participating in certain competitions.

Deletes role of Board of Dentistry in administration of licensure examination for dentists & requirement for board to establish examination fee; revises requirements for licensure as dentist; deletes time limitation on validity of licensure examination results; deletes requirement applicants for licensure engage in full-time practice of dentistry inside geographic boundaries of this state for 1 year after licensure; revises continuing education requirements for dentists.

Reducing minimum threshold amount for grand theft of third degree; creates new offense of grand theft offenses; provides enhanced criminal penalties for committing petit theft of first degree & having certain previous convictions; revises number of thefts required within specified aggregation period required to commit specified violation for retail theft; revises specified timeframes in which individual acts of retail theft may be aggregated; prohibits retail theft with specified number of other persons for specified purpose; prohibits retail theft when social media platform is used to solicit participation; requires person convicted of retail theft to pay specified restitution.
Revises the definition of the term "eligible telecommunications carrier"; authorizes the PSC to designate certain entities as eligible telecommunications carriers for a specified purpose.

Revises requirements for specified school district strategic plan to include certain information; requires DOE to include specified data in annual review of K-12 & postsecondary career & technical education offerings; & requires school districts to inform students & parents of specified information during middle school course selection
Expands types of reports that DCF must refer to Child Protection Teams.

Provides requirements for construction & inspection of movable tiny home; requires movable tiny home to have sticker or other documentation certifying compliance therewith; requires Florida Building Commission to review updates to certain codes which pertain to requirements for movable tiny homes.

Requires adoption entities to submit annual report with certain information to DCF; requires department to retain electronic copy of certain documentation; revises amount of authorized fees, costs, & expenses; prohibits & authorizes court to reject certain fees; requires court to include written determination of reasonableness if court approves fees, costs, & expenses in excess of certain limits; requires certain information to be included in annual report department submits to Governor & Legislature; revises provisions relating to the statewide adoption exchange.

Establishes procedure to allow adult who has mental capacity & who has terminal condition & who makes fully informed decision that he or she no longer wants to live, to obtain medication to end his or her life; provides requirements for health care providers, health care facilities & DOH.

Defines "person with lived experience"; provides qualifications for person seeking certification as person with lived experience; requires continuum of care lead agencies to submit certain information to DCF for purposes of background screening; prescribing screening requirements; specifies disqualifying offenses for person applying for certification; authorizes person who does not meet background screening requirements to request from department exemption from disqualification.

bill_title: Coverage by Citizens Property Insurance Corporation
bill_desc: Revises eligibility for coverage of residential structures in certain counties by Citizens Property Insurance Corporation; requires corporation to annually implement certain rate increases in such counties for single policies issued by corporation; provides additional policies issued by corporation that do not require policyholders to purchase flood insurance as condition for maintaining policies; specifies requirement for flood insurance.

bill_title: Medicaid Expansion through Medicaid Buy-in Program
bill_desc: Requires AHCA to establish & implement Medicaid buy-in program for specified individuals with disabilities; provides requirements for program; requires agency to seek by specified date federal waiver approval or submit any state plan amendments necessary to implement program.

Abolishes common-law doctrine of home venue privilege with respect to action against state; increases statutory limits on liability for tort claims against state & its agencies & subdivisions; authorizes subdivision of state to settle claim in excess of statutory limit without further action by Legislature regardless of insurance coverage limits; prohibits insurance policy from conditioning payment of benefits on enactment of claim bill; specifies limitations in effect on date claim accrues apply to that claim; revises period within which certain claims must be present to certain entities; revises exceptions relating to instituting actions on tort claims against state or one of its agencies or subdivisions; revises period after which failure of certain entities to make final disposition of claim shall be deemed final denial of claim; revises statute of limitations for tort claims against state or one of its agencies or subdivisions & exceptions thereto.

bill_title: Florida Medical School Scholarship and Grant Program
bill_desc: Establishes Florida Medical School Scholarship & Grant Program within Florida Education Fund; provides requirements for program & fund.

bill_title: Task Force on Public Safety in Urban and Inner-City Communities
bill_desc: Creates Task Force on Public Safety in Urban & Inner-City Communities; provides for membership, staff support, meetings, duties, & powers; requires executive director of FDLE to issue subpoenas; authorizes task force to seek assistance from state agencies & to access certain exempt or confidential & exempt information or records; provides requirements for such access; requires reports; provides for sunset of task force & repeal of provisions; provides appropriation.

bill_title: Pub. Meetings/Task Force on Public Safety in Urban and Inner-City Communities
bill_desc: Provides exemption from public meetings requirements for portions of meetings of Task Force on Public Safety in Urban & Inner-City Communities at which exempt or confidential & exempt information is discussed; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.
Revises spaceport territory to include certain property.

bill_title: Use of Private Providers for Plans Review and Inspection
bill_desc: Requires private provider firms to qualify as business organizations; authorizes owner or contractor to file complaint with Department of Commerce against local jurisdiction if certain fees are not reduced; requires local jurisdiction to immediately refund fees; authorizes DOC to assess certain fines; prohibits local persons & entities from conducting its own plans review or inspections if private provider is retained; requires local building official to issue permit or provide specified written notice within certain time period.

Requires DOH to contract with & establish network of swimming lesson vendors to participate in program; requires DOH to secure vendor in each county; requires vendors to participate in program if requested by DOH; requires DOH to establish application process; specifies eligibility criteria; provides program is subject to specific appropriation; authorizes DOH to seek grants or other public & private funding for program.
Revises exception to maximum allowable capacity for individual container of wine sold in this state.

bill_title: Access to Financial Institution Customer Accounts
bill_desc: Provides additional grounds for qualified public depositories to be suspended & disqualified; authorizes OFR to receive complaints from customer or member who reasonably believes that financial institution has acted in bad faith in terminating, suspending, or taking similar action restricting access to such customer's or member's account; provides duties of office upon receipt of complaint; provides duties of financial institution upon receipt of notification that complaint has been filed; authorizes office to provide certain reports & information to specified entities; provides that financial institutions' customers & members have cause of action; authorizes such customers & members to recover damages, together with costs & attorney fees; provides time limit for initiating causes of action.

bill_title: Pub. Rec./Access to Financial Institution Customer Accounts
bill_desc: Provides public records exemption for termination-of-access reports filed by financial institutions with OFR, for information contained in such reports, & for personally identifying & personal financial information contained in complaints filed by customers or members & in determinations issued by office related to such complaints & reports; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statements of public necessity.

bill_title: Criminal Conflict and Civil Regional Counsel Membership in the Senior Management Service Class
bill_desc: Provides participation in Senior Management Service Class of FRS is compulsory for assistant regional counsel supervisors, beginning on a specified date.

Designates month of April as "Hot Car Death Prevention Month"; encourages specified entities to sponsor events to promote public awareness on dangers of leaving child unattended in motor vehicle & provide methods to prevent hot car deaths.

Revises requirements for rights as beneficiary of order & acceptance of order when beneficiary is nonexistent or unidentifiable person or account; removes rules relating to accepted payment orders; revises requirements relating to misdescription of banks for intermediaries & beneficiaries.

Requires DBPR to establish searchable database by specified date which contains specified information regarding each homeowners' association in state; requires homeowners' association to notify department of any changes to information listed in database.

bill_title: Fleeing or Attempting to Elude Law Enforcement Officer
bill_desc: Provides mandatory minimum sentences for violations; provides for pretrial diversion for first-time offenders.

Specifies employment policy of state relating to person's sex; prohibits employees & contractors of certain employers from being required to use, from providing, & from being asked to provide certain titles & pronouns; prohibits employees & contractors from being penalized or subjected to certain actions for not providing certain titles & pronouns; prohibits adverse personnel action on basis of deeply held religious or biology-based beliefs; provides administrative & civil remedies; provides that it is unlawful employment practice for nonprofit organization to require certain training, instruction, or activity.

bill_title: Complaints Against Law Enforcement and Correctional Officers
bill_desc: Preempts regulation of complaints against law enforcement officers & correctional officers to state.

Increases size of distilled spirits containers that may be sold or distributed; authorizes entities to conduct tastings & sales at specified locations; provides requirements related to issuance of permits; provides broker or sales agent may be used in place of distillery representative at spirituous beverage tasting.

Specifies requirement regarding amount charged or financed for vehicle value protection agreement; specifies financial security requirements for providers; requires vehicle value protection agreements to include certain written disclosures in clear & understandable language & state terms, restrictions, or conditions governing cancellation; defines "excess wear & use waiver"; authorizes retail lessee to contract with retail lessor for an excess wear & use waiver; prohibits conditioning terms of consumer's motor vehicle lease on his or her payment for any excess wear & use waiver; requires certain disclosures for lease agreement that includes an excess wear & use waiver.
Establishes minimum timeframe for retention of specified sexual offense evidence; requires specified protocols for storing of specified sexual offense evidence.

Revising provisions related to local business taxes including conditions imposed on taxing authorities governing levies, modification of ordinances, reclassification of businesses, prohibitions on revenues over a specified value, and audits.

Adds credit unions to list of financial institutions eligible to be qualified public depositories; prohibits CFO from designating credit unions as qualified public depositories unless certain conditions are met; requires CFO to withdraw from collateral agreement with credit union under certain circumstances; authorizes CFO to limit amount of public deposits credit union may hold; specifies losses against which certain solvent banks, savings banks, savings associations, & credit unions must guarantee public depositors; requires CFO to segregate & separately account for proceeds, assessments, & administrative penalties attributable to credit union from those attributable to other specified financial institutions.

Revises powers, duties, & obligations of Division of Florida Condominiums, Timeshares, & Mobile Homes of DBPR; revises provisions relating to mediation & mediator selection; provides requirements relating to live-in health care aides; revises amounts of certain expenses that Florida Mobile Home Relocation Corporation is required to pay mobile home owner; specifies amounts that park owner must pay corporation.

Requires district school boards to adopt policy requiring certain school personnel to be certified in cardiopulmonary resuscitation; provides requirements for such policy; & provides for staggered implementation of such policy.

bill_title: Law Clerks for Circuit Court Judges
bill_desc: Provides for law clerk for each circuit court judge; specifies base salary.
Provides applicability; requires that contracts with certain professional firms must, to extent permitted by law, provide indemnity to DOT.

Revises provisions concerning unlawful detention by transient occupant of residential property; prohibits knowingly & willfully presenting false document purporting to be valid lease agreement, deed, or other instrument conveying real property rights.

Provides requirements for express written warranties & home warranties transferred to subsequent home purchasers; defines unfair method of competition & unfair or deceptive act or practice; provides for application.

Provides that rates charged for certain commercial lines residential condominium wind-only policies by Citizens Property Insurance Corporation are not subject to specified rate increases; requires authorized inspectors to use specified inspection form for inspections of residential structure & commercial structure roofs.

Requires prospective purchasers of parcel subject to association membership to be provided with certain documents, in addition to disclosure summary, before executing contract; authorizes prospective purchasers to cancel their contract within specified timeframe; specifies that 3-day cancellation period does not include Saturdays, Sundays, or legal holidays.

Establishes Florida Women's Historical Marker Initiative within Division of Historical Resources of DOS; provides purpose of initiative; establishes Women's Historical Marker Selection Committee; provides for membership & duties; provides criteria for recognition by initiative; requires Florida Historical Marker Program to place certain number of historical markers over certain time period.

Revises eligibility requirements for young adult to receive aftercare services; limits aftercare services available to certain young adults; authorizes DCF to distribute federal funds to young adults, regardless of their eligibility, under certain circumstances.

bill_title: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Awareness and Assistance Training Program
bill_desc: Creates Mental Health & Substance Use Disorder Awareness & Assistance Training Program; requires DCF to establish program; provides program requirements; requires DCF to select coordinating agency; provides requirements for such coordinating agency; requires coordinating agency to submit reports to DCF.

bill_title: Child Care and Early Learning Providers
bill_desc: Revises positions related to tax credits for corporations providing or paying for child care; licensing standards for child care facilities; child care personnel; minimum standards; child care regulation; & large family child care homes.

Authorizes firefighter, law enforcement officer, correctional officer, & correctional probation officer to receive medical treatment by medical specialist for certain conditions; provides requirements for firefighter's or officer's workers compensation carrier, self-insured employer, or third-party administrator; requires continuing care & treatment by medical specialist to be reasonable, necessary, & related to firefighter's or officer's condition & authorized by workers compensation carrier, self-insured employer, or third-party administrator; specifies reimbursement percentage for such treatment.

bill_title: Coverage of Out-of-network Ground Ambulance Emergency Services
bill_desc: Requires health insurers & HMOs to reimburse out-of-network ambulance service providers at specified rates for providing emergency services; prohibits cost-sharing responsibilities paid for out-of-network ambulance service provider from exceeding those of in-network ambulance service provider for covered services; requires health insurers & HMOs to remit payment for covered services if such transportation was requested by first responder or health care professionals.
Removes provisions relating to limited temporary cash assistance for children born to families receiving temporary cash assistance.

bill_title: Prohibited Discrimination Based on Hairstyle in the Education System
bill_desc: Prohibits discrimination based on protected hairstyle in Florida K-20 public education system; provides that term "race" includes protected hairstyles for purposes of United States Code within public & private education system.
Directs DHSMV to develop Clearwater Marine Aquarium license plate; provides for distribution & use of fees collected from sale of plate.

bill_title: Equal Rights for Men and Women
bill_desc: Ratifies proposed amendment to U.S. Constitution relating to equal rights for men & women.
Authorizes operation of utility terrain vehicles on certain roadways; provides applicability of certain operator requirements.

bill_title: Civil Liability for the Wrongful Death of an Unborn Child
bill_desc: Revises definition of term "survivors" to include parents of unborn child; prohibits right of action against mother for wrongful death of unborn child; authorizes parents of unborn child to recover certain damages.

Repeals provisions, relating to application of Florida Motor Vehicle No-Fault Law; revises requirement for proof of security on motor vehicle; revises motor vehicle insurance coverages that applicant must show to register vehicles with DHSMV; revises garage liability insurance requirements for motor vehicle dealer license applicants; revises minimum liability coverage requirements for motor vehicle owners or operators; revises legal liability of uninsured motorist coverage insurer; revises required coverages for motor vehicle insurance policy; requires that motor vehicle insurance policies provide death benefits provides appropriation.

Requires OIR to establish Condominium Windstorm Pilot Program for specified purpose; requires office to submit certain information to Legislature by specified date; provides for expiration of program; requires majority vote of total voting interests of condominium association in order to participate in program; provides requirements for associations to participate in program; requires insurance policies issued under program to align with estimated reserves of association; authorizes office, in collaboration with other stakeholders, to create certain educational materials.

bill_title: Documentation Status for Health Care Services
bill_desc: Provides licensed not-for-profit corporations & organizations are not required to request citizenship, residency, alien, or immigration status of any patient.

Prohibits health plans from declining to participate in filed claims; provides defaults against health plans for failure to respond; requires health plans to pay providers amounts provided in claim dispute orders under certain circumstances; requires prescription drug benefits-ID cards & health insurance & HMO ID cards to include specified information.

Requires counties to establish maximum rates for storage of electric vehicles; authorizes wrecker operator's storage facility to charge certain costs for certain cleanup, containment, & disposal; specifies financial responsibility for vehicles stored for more than 30 days at wrecker operator's storage facility; authorizes governmental entity to instruct or authorize removal of vehicle or vessel; requires certain communications among governmental entity, DHSMV, & person in charge of location where vehicle or vessel is stored; requires public notice of sale of unclaimed vehicle or vessel to be published in electronic format approved or operated by DHSMV; removes requirement that notice be published in newspaper.

Creates presumption of legal father; authorizes certain persons to rebut such presumption by filing petition to determine paternity; provides requirements relating to petition, appointment of guardian ad litem & attorney ad litem, evidentiary hearings & trial, burden of proof, genetic testing, objections to test results, determining best interests of child, & final order determining paternity; authorizes & provides requirements for court to approve, grant, or modify parenting plan & establish child support orders.

bill_title: Expedited Approval of Residential Building Permits
bill_desc: Requires governing bodies to create or update program to expedite process for issuing residential building permits; authorizes applicants to use private provider; requires governing body to establish registry of qualified contractors for specified purpose; authorizes governing body to issue addresses & temporary parcel identification numbers; requires governing body to issue specified number or percentage of building permits; provides applicant has vested rights when conditions are met; prohibits governing body from making changes to preliminary plat without written consent; requires applicant to indemnify & hold harmless certain entities & persons.

Revises requirements for calculation of additional full-time equivalent membership & certain bonuses based on IB examination scores of students to include students who earn equivalent scores as determined by DOE; requiring OPPAGA to conduct a specified study.
Urges Federal Government to secure the southern border of the United States and fix the legal immigration system.

Requires law enforcement officer to transport ballot boxes or ballot transfer containers from supervisor of elections to precinct; requires all ballot boxes & ballot transfer containers be supervised by law enforcement officer at all times; requires ballot boxes, ballots, ballot stubs, memoranda, & papers to be transported by law enforcement officer.

Requires law enforcement officers to complete lethality assessment form when investigating alleged incidents of domestic violence; provides requirements for completing form; requires FDLE to approve statewide lethality assessment form; provides requirements for form; requires department to consult with specified entities on policies, procedures, & training necessary to implement use of form; provides minimum requirements for such policies, procedures, & training; prohibits law enforcement officers from completing lethality assessment form if they have not received certain training.

bill_title: State Recognition of Indian Tribes and Bands
bill_desc: Provides for state recognition of specified Indian tribes & bands.

Provides administrative leave for certain employees; requires certain locations to display information about organ donation & registration; requires courses include information about organ donation; requires link to statewide organ donation registry be included on specified websites; prohibits insurance policies from limiting or excluding coverage for living organ donors.
Provides requirements for fantasy sports contests & penalties for violations; exempts fantasy sports contests from certain laws.

Requires OPPAGA to perform study to determine most effective means of creating online voter registration database with certain capabilities; requires OPPAGA to submit report to Governor & Legislature.
Authorizes PSC to establish experimental mechanism to facilitate certain energy infrastructure investment & to make determinations regarding such mechanism.

Creates Florida Veterans' History Program within Division of Arts & Culture of DOS as Florida Folklife Program; provides purpose; authorizes division to request assistance from DVA; requires division's folklorists to seek out & identify certain veterans; authorizes division or folklorist to interview such veterans or invite them to submit written or electronic accounts of their experiences; authorizes division to contract with third-party vendor; authorizes division to adopt rules.

bill_title: Use of Campaign Funds for Child Care Expenses
bill_desc: Authorizes candidate to use funds on deposit in his or her campaign account to pay for child care expenses under specified conditions.

bill_title: Ad Valorem Tax Exemption for Nonprofit Homes for the Aged
bill_desc: Revises ownership entities for certain nonprofit homes qualifying for exemption from ad valorem taxation to include certain limited partnerships.

bill_title: Town of Horseshoe Beach, Dixie County
bill_desc: Provides exception to general law; requires Division of Alcoholic Beverages & Tobacco of DBPR to issue special alcoholic beverage license to certain restaurants which meet space, seating, & minimum gross revenue requirements; provides conditions for revocation of such license or denial of pending application for such license.

Applies to Congress of United States to call convention for sole purpose of proposing amendments to Constitution of United States to set limit on number of terms to which person may be elected as member of United States House of Representatives & to set limit on number of terms to which person may be elected as member of the United States Senate.

Requires health care facilities to implement & maintain staffing plans; specifies minimum staffing levels for direct care registered nurses based on hospital or clinical unit setting; requires that patients be cared for only in hospital or clinical units that meet specified minimum staffing levels; prohibits health care facilities from using video cameras or monitors as substitute for direct observation; exempts health care facilities from minimum staffing level requirements during declared state of emergency; provides whistle-blower protections; creates cause of action; prohibits employers from taking actions with respect to employment for certain unionized staff.

bill_title: State Legal Tender and Bullion Depository
bill_desc: Provides specie legal tender & electronic currency are legal tender; provides bullion is not personal property for taxation & regulatory purposes; requires DFS to establish & administer bullion depository; authorizes governmental entities to use depositories for storing bullion; authorizes State Treasury to deposit portion of its funds into depositories in form of bullion; requires CFO to establish electronic currencies backed by specie legal tender & other bullion; requires CFO to hold specie legal tender & other bullion as bailment for specified purposes.

Provides public records exemption for records of accounts in bullion depositories & of transactions, deposits, & withdrawals associated with such accounts; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

Prohibits sale of rabbits in specified locations & during specified months; specifies unlawful acts relating to sales of rabbits; provides requirements for rabbits offered for sale at retail pet stores; requires retail pet stores to maintain & make available specified records; provides for retrieval, return, & placement of abandoned rabbits; authorizes compliance inspections; provides exceptions.
Concurrent resolution applying to Congress of United States to call convention for sole purpose of proposing an amendment to Constitution of United States which requires balanced federal budget.
Revises definition of term "public works project" to include activities paid for with local funds.

Authorizes state university to retain & report annual reserve balance exceeding specified amount; & authorizes state university's carry forward spending plan to include reserve fund to be used for authorized expenses in subsequent years.
Authorizes in-store servicing of distilled spirits sold by distributor to vendor.

bill_title: Coverage for Mammograms and Supplemental Breast Cancer Screenings
bill_desc: Requires AHCA to provide coverage for yearly mammograms & yearly supplemental breast cancer screenings for certain women; revises coverages for mammograms under certain individual accident & health insurance policies, group, blanket, & franchise accident & health insurance policies, & HMOs; requires coverages for supplemental breast cancer screenings under such policies & contracts.
Expands coverage of prohibition on battery involving contact with bodily substances.
Provides public records exemptions for specified veterans treatment court program records & mental health court program records; provides statement of public necessity.

bill_title: Financial Support for Pregnant Survivors of Rape or Incest
bill_desc: Provides that certain low-income students who are pregnant as result of rape or incest & who decide to carry pregnancy to term are exempt from paying specified postsecondary tuition & fees; & establishes Academic Success of Pregnant Students Who Are Victims of Sexual Abuse Grant Program within DOE.

Requires swimming pools located on residential real property that is transferred or sold on or after specified date to meet certain pool safety & pool barrier requirements; requires certain persons to report violations of law to local law enforcement agency.
Prohibits person from intimidating, threatening, coercing, or harassing election worker with specified intent; provides criminal penalties.

Requires comprehensive plans & plan amendments that apply to certain lands within or near Everglades Protection Area to follow state coordinated review process; provides duties of DEP relating to such plans & plan amendments; provides additional limitation for compliance determination of such plans & plan amendments; prohibits & provides requirements for adoption of certain development amendments within Everglades Protection Area.

Revises eligibility for residency in Veterans' Domiciliary Home of Florida to include specified individuals; adds such individuals to priority of admittance schedule; revises admission eligibility for veterans' nursing homes to include specified persons; revises priority of admittance to include such persons.
Increases the value of a certain tax exemption.

Requires law enforcement officers who investigate incident of domestic violence to administer lethality assessment; requires FDLE to consult with specified entities to develop & implement assessment; requires training for officers; provides required questions for assessment; requires officers to advise victim of results of lethality assessment & refer victim to domestic violence centers; prohibits officers from disclosing domestic violence center to which victim was referred; requires officers to document information in written police report.

Requires OIR to consider recovery of funds under specified provisions in reviewing rates; requires insurers to report recovery of funds under specified provisions; specifies that insured's payment of deductible or copayment is not condition of an insurer's payment obligations.
Directs DHSMV to develop The Villages: May All Your Dreams Come True license plate; provides for distribution & use of fees collected from sale of plate.

Prohibits individuals from soliciting or accepting anything of value from foreign country of concern; prohibits person from lobbying county, municipality, or special district unless registered as lobbyist; establishes requirements for registration, compliance, investigations, & registration fees; prohibits entities from renewing or extending employment contracts during specified timeframe; requires specified number of members of governing body to be physically present at meeting for quorum purposes; authorizes members to participate in deliberations of governing body through technology.
Provides for reclassification of theft offenses of specified amounts from nonprofit organizations; requires restitution & community service for certain violations.

bill_title: North Brevard County Hospital District, Brevard County
bill_desc: Revises appointment & membership of district board; requires board to determine operating budget & estimated revenues of district; removes provisions relating to ad valorem taxation; revises disposition of assets & liabilities in event of dissolution; requires district to conduct valuation; requires district to solicit bids for sale of assets; provides for transfer; provides for dissolution of district; provides offices & terms of board members end on certain date.

bill_title: Town of Hillsboro Beach, Broward County
bill_desc: Requires Division of Alcoholic Beverages & Tobacco of DBPR to issue special alcoholic beverage license to residential condominium that meets certain requirements; limits issuance of such license & provision & sale of alcoholic beverages under such license; authorizes division to regulate & supervise residential condominiums to which such licenses have been issued; authorizes division to revoke or suspend such licenses.
Provides for use of xylazine as an animal drug in certain circumstances.

bill_title: First Offense Conditional Release Pilot Program
bill_desc: Creates pilot program for conditional release of certain first-time offenders; provides program requirements; provides for conditions of release; requires report; provides for termination of admissions to program by specified date unless renewed by Legislature; provides for inmates admitted to program before admissions terminated.

Requires FDLE to create program to appoint & supervise unpaid auxiliary law enforcement officers with statewide jurisdiction to support law enforcement agencies; specifies status of such officers; provides training courses may be taught from any location in virtual classroom without an instructor present.

Provides maximum voluntary freeboard requirements for new construction & substantial improvements to existing construction; prohibits voluntary freeboard from being used in calculation of maximum allowable height for certain construction; authorizes local governments to adopt by ordinance minimum freeboard requirement or maximum voluntary freeboard that exceeds minimum requirements; requires Florida Building Commission to adopt by rule minimum freeboard requirements & to incorporate such requirements into next edition of FBC; requires commission to review freeboard requirements every 5 years.

bill_title: Use of Criminal History in Licensing
bill_desc: Revises state agency reporting requirements; defines "conviction"; authorizes applicable boards or DBPR to make certain findings relating to rehabilitation during licensing decisions; provides factors that must be considered in making such findings.
Designates American flamingo as official state bird; provides that such designation supersedes designation of mockingbird.

Revises Charter of Canaveral Port District, Brevard County; provides for increase in amount of levied tax permitted to be used for payment of principal & interest on revenue certificates & bonds; requires port authority to take reasonable measures to support Commercial Space Launch Industry & to submit annual report.

bill_title: Defamation, False Light, and Unauthorized Publication of Name or Likenesses
bill_desc: Requires certain articles or broadcasts be removed from Internet within specified period to limit damages for defamation; provides persons in certain positions relating to newspapers with immunity for defamation if such persons exercise due care to prevent utterance of such statement; provides venue for damages for defamation or privacy tort based on material broadcast over radio or television; provides venue for damages for defamation or privacy tort based on material published, exhibited, or uttered on Internet; provides for motion for veracity hearing in defamation or privacy tort action; provides that person who uses artificial intelligence to create or edit any form of media is subject to liability.

Prohibits panhandling under certain circumstances; prohibits person from approaching operator or other occupant of motor vehicle for purpose of panhandling; provides additional violations that constitute felony; requires individuals engaged in solicitation in certain areas to identify on whose behalf & for what purpose contributions are being solicited.
Revises verification requirements for specified interpersonal violence injunction petitions.
Authorizes clerks of court to fund improvements to court technology from filing fees, service charges, court costs, & fines; revises distribution of civil penalty.

bill_title: Leave of Absence to Officials and Employees
bill_desc: Provides that certain public officials & employees may receive full pay for leave of absence relating to active federal military service that lasts certain length of time.
Prohibits individual from losing his or her resident status for tuition purposes solely because of his or her incarceration.

bill_title: Assessment of Renewable Energy Source Devices
bill_desc: Revises definition of term "renewable energy source device."

bill_title: Autonomous Practice for Certified Psychiatric Nurses
bill_desc: Authorizes advanced practice registered nurse who is certified as psychiatric nurse practitioner to engage in autonomous practice under certain circumstances.

bill_title: Coverage for Diagnostic and Supplemental Breast Examinations
bill_desc: Prohibits state group insurance program from imposing on enrollee any cost-sharing requirement with respect to coverage for diagnostic breast examinations & supplemental breast examinations.

Authorizes parent to surrender infant with medical staff or licensed healthcare professional at hospital after delivery; authorizes parent to surrender infant by dialing 911 to request that EMS provider meet surrendering parent at specified location; requires surrendering parent to stay with infant until EMS provider arrives to take custody of infant.

bill_title: Municipal Water or Sewer Utility Rates, Fees, and Charges
bill_desc: Removes provision authorizing certain municipalities serving consumers outside their boundaries to add specific surcharges to rates, fees, & charges; removes provision which does not require public hearing for adding specific surcharges; requires certain municipalities to conduct rate studies by specified dates which evaluate future capital needs, whether rates are expected to generate sufficient revenues to cover costs & support investments, & whether costs are equitably distributed.

bill_title: United States-produced Iron and Steel in Public Works Projects
bill_desc: Requires governmental entities to include requirement in certain contracts that certain iron or steel products must be produced in United States; provides exceptions; authorizes use of foreign steel & iron materials in certain circumstances; requires DMS & DOT to adopt rules.

Authorizes, rather than requires, responsible public entity to publish notice of unsolicited proposal for qualifying project in specified manner & that other proposals for same project will be accepted; authorizes responsible public entity to proceed with unsolicited proposal for qualifying project without public bidding process if responsible public entity holds public meeting that meets certain requirements & holds a subsequent public meeting at which responsible public entity makes certain determination; requires responsible public entity to consider certain factors; requires responsible public entity to publish certain report in Florida Administrative Register for certain period in certain circumstances; revises certain determinations that responsible public entity must make before approving comprehensive agreement.

bill_title: Medicaid Managed Care Plan Performance Metrics
bill_desc: Requires AHCA to produce certain Medicaid managed care performance data submitted by Medicaid managed care plans; requires agency to contract with third party vendor to publish such data on dashboard quarterly; requires agency to submit annual report to certain entities.

Authorizes persons without license to practice barbering to perform limited barbering in licensed barbershops if certain requirements are met; authorizes Barbers' Board to discipline persons authorized to perform limited barbering.

bill_title: Use or Threatened Use of Force
bill_desc: Removes provisions stating that persons who use or threaten to use force, other than deadly force, do not have duty to retreat before using or threatening to use such force in defense of persons or property; prohibits use of deadly force by person who knows that he or she can avoid using deadly force with complete safety by retreating; removes provisions stating that person using or threatening to use deadly force does not have duty to retreat & has right to stand his or her ground; repeals provisions relating to immunity from criminal prosecution & civil action for justifiable use or threatened use of force.

Requires that nonindustrial stormwater management systems be designed with side slopes that meet certain minimum design requirements; superseding certain side slope rules; revises construction relating to causes of action for damages to real or personal property directly resulting from certain discharges or other conditions of pollution.

Requires counties & municipalities to meet specified requirements regarding minimum information necessary for certain zoning applications; revises timeframes for processing applications for approvals of development permits or development orders; defines "substantive change"; provides refund parameters in situations where county or municipality fails to meet certain timeframes.

bill_title: Coral Springs Improvement District, Broward County
bill_desc: Prohibits board of supervisors of district from receiving bids on certain contracts; provides exception; requires board to comply with certain statutory bidding procedures; authorizes board to reject all bids if such rejection is in best interests of district; provides that competitive bidding for certain contracts is subject to statutory provisions; authorizes district to apply to DMS to purchase certain commodities & contractual services.
Requires school districts to offer at least four, instead of two, career-themed courses; provides requirements for such courses; & revises requirements for calculation of school & district grades.

bill_title: Notice of Restoration of Voting Rights Information on Sentencing Scoresheets
bill_desc: Specifies information to be provided on sentencing scoresheets concerning restoration of voting rights; requires scoresheet to be provided to defendant before sentence is imposed.

bill_title: Easements Affecting Real Property Owned by Same Owner
bill_desc: Authorizes owner of real property to create easement, servitude, or other interest in owner's real property & providing that such easement, servitude, or other interest is valid; provides that act does not revive or reinstate right or interest that has been adjudicated invalid before certain date.

bill_title: Alzheimer's Disease and Related Dementia Training for Law Enforcement Officers
bill_desc: Requires FDLE to establish online, continued employment training component relating to Alzheimer's disease & related forms of dementia; requires training component be developed with DOEA; specifies instruction requirements for training; authorizes completion of such training to count toward certain requirement.

Renames natural gas fuel fleet vehicle rebate program within DACS as alternative fuel fleet vehicle rebate program; provides eligibility under program for electric & hybrid motor vehicles; specifies dates for vehicle operation & annual assessments & reports.
Proposes amendment of State Constitution to prohibit use of traffic infraction detectors within this state.
Designates act "Laderius Clardy Act"; provides criminal penalties for offense of drive-by shooting.

Requires insurer to offer policy that provides coverage limit on dwelling equal to unpaid principal balance of all mortgage loans on risk; requires insurer issuing such policy to obtain certain signed statement; specifies language for such statement; prohibits personal lines residential property insurer from requiring coverage limit that includes value of land upon which dwelling sits.

bill_title: Pub. Rec./County and City Administrators and Managers
bill_desc: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying & location information of current county administrators, deputy county administrators, assistant county administrators, city managers, deputy city managers, & assistant city managers, including names & personal identifying & location information of spouses & children of current county administrators, deputy county administrators, assistant county administrators, city managers, deputy city managers, & assistant city managers; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides for retroactive application; provides statement of public necessity.

Authorizes certified public accountants to apply to DBPR to place their licenses on retired status; provides requirements for application; provides that licensee loses retired status in certain circumstances; authorizes retired licensee to take certain actions without losing retired status; requires certain affirmation; authorizes retired licensee to accept reimbursements or per diem amounts; prohibits retired licensee from offering or rendering certain professional services; provides for reactivation of retired licensee's license; provides requirements for conditions of such reactivation.

Creates, revises, & removes liquefied petroleum gas provisions relating to remote bulk storage locations; dealers & qualifiers; examinations, certifications, & licenses; powers & authority of DACS; documents for service on equipment & systems; & container use restrictions.

Requires tax collector, upon petition, to appoint general lines insurance agency as authorized agent for issuing titles, registration certificates, registration license plates, validation stickers, & mobile home stickers; requires agency to file performance bond with & provide audited financial statements to DHSMV; authorizes agency to provide services solely to its customers; limits number of locations at which agency may offer services; requires tax collector to authorize agency to access electronic filing system; specifies provisions of law to which agency is subject; authorizes DHSMV to adopt rules.

bill_title: Lehigh Acres Municipal Services Improvement District, Hendry and Lee Counties
bill_desc: Expands territorial boundaries of district.

bill_title: Melbourne-Tillman Water Control District, Brevard County
bill_desc: Revises maximum stormwater management user fees for residential, agricultural, & commercial parcels of land.

bill_title: North Okaloosa Fire District, Okaloosa County
bill_desc: Authorizes Board of Fire Commissioners of district to establish schedule of impact fees for new construction within its jurisdictional boundaries; provides for use of such impact fees; requires recordkeeping; authorizes agreements with general purpose local governments for certain purposes.

Revises timeframe within which excavator is required to provide certain information through free-access notification system established by Sunshine State One-Call of Florida, Inc.; revises timeframes during which member operators who receive such notifications are required to mark horizontal route of underground facility & provide positive response to system; provides noncriminal infraction subject to enhanced civil penalties for specified violation.

Reclassifies intern registrations as associate registrations for professions of clinical social work, marriage & family therapy, & mental health counseling; removes requirement that licensed mental health professional be present on premises when registered associates, formerly classified as registered interns, are providing clinical services in private practice setting.

bill_title: Autism Spectrum Disorder Training for Law Enforcement Officers
bill_desc: Provides requirements for training officers regarding individuals with autism spectrum disorder; requires Criminal Justice Standards & Training Commission to adopt rules requiring such training as part of continued employment training.

Establishes procedures for licensure by DACS; authorizes sheriff to provide supporting documentation to application for licensure; specifies duration of license; specifies conditions under which license must be revoked; authorizes sheriff to enter into agreement with owner of enhanced firearms training facility to conduct training for school guardian program at facility; exempts enhanced firearms training facility from complying with specified local government requirements in certain circumstances.
Requires public safety program established, created, funded, administered, or promoted by sheriff & municipal law enforcement agency, respectively, to meet certain conditions.
Exempts certain impact-resistant items from specified taxes.

Requires law enforcement agencies to review certain cold cases upon receiving written application from designated person & make specified determination; provides requirements for such reviews; requires law enforcement agencies to conduct full reinvestigation of cold case; provides requirements for such reinvestigations; requires certain procedures to ensure compliance; requires law enforcement agencies to provide specified training; requires law enforcement agencies to provide written confirmation of receipt of application; requires written explanation of reason or reasons for denial; provides timeframe & notice requirements; requires law enforcement agencie to report certain data to Global Forensic & Justice Center at FIU; requires coordination between law enforcement agencies if more than one law enforcement agency conducted initial investigation;; authorizes medical examiner to issue death certificates with nonspecific causes of death & manner of murder.

bill_title: Employment Leave for Crime Victims and Witnesses
bill_desc: Provides that crime victim & their family members & witnesses to crimes may take leave from their employers for certain purposes; provides duties of employees; prohibits certain actions by employers.
Designates AWF3 Mohammed "Mo" Haitham Memorial Way in Hillsborough & Pinellas Counties; directs DOT to erect suitable markers.

Creates Board of Naturopathic Medicine within DOH; requires board, in conjunction with DOH, to establish disciplinary training program for board members; prohibits certain unlicensed persons from practicing naturopathic medicine or promoting, identifying, or describing themselves using specified titles or abbreviations; provides for licensure by examination & by endorsement, respectively, of naturopathic physicians; requires DOH & board to use DOH's investigative process to ensure that applicants meet applicable criteria; revises requirements for licensure renewal & continuing education requirements for naturopathic physicians; provides financial responsibility requirements as condition of licensure; establishes Naturopathic Medical Formulary Council; provides for membership of council; requires council to establish Naturopathic Medical Formulary.

Requires Board of Naturopathic Medicine to establish certain fees; provides for fees for licensure by examination & licensure by endorsement, respectively, of naturopathic physicians; provides for licensure renewal fees; authorizes board to set by rule certain fees related to inactive licenses & reactivation of licensure.
Revises criteria for child to receive priority for participation in school readiness program; provides eligibility requirements for school readiness program provider to receive specified funding.

Authorizes licensed veterinarians to practice veterinary telehealth in accordance with specified criteria; specifies powers of Board of Veterinary Medicine related to practice of telehealth; specifies drugs veterinarian practicing telehealth may provide; provides specific authorizations for cases where patient is food-producing species; authorizes specified people to vaccinate dogs, cats, & ferrets against rabies; provides supervising veterinarian assumes responsibility for specified people who provide vaccinations.
Defines "nonprofit agricultural organization"; provides that health coverage provided by nonprofit agricultural organizations is not insurance for purposes of Florida Insurance Code.

bill_title: Reemployment of Retired Law Enforcement Officers
bill_desc: Authorizes retired law enforcement officers to be reemployed in specified positions; authorizes such retired law enforcement officers to receive both compensation & retirement benefits; provides that such retired law enforcement officers may not renew membership in FRS.

Requires dentists & certain partnerships, or corporations to designate with board dentist of record & provide information to certain patients; requires any individual, partnership, or corporation that provides dental services through telehealth to make available specified information; defines term "advertisement"; requires advertisements of dental services provided through telehealth to include specified disclaimer; provides requirements for initial examination for orthodontic appliances; defines "in-person examination."

bill_title: Youth Conflict Resolution and Peer Mediation Pilot Program
bill_desc: Establishes Youth Conflict Resolution and Peer Mediation Pilot Program within the Community School Grant Program; provides requirements for program.
Revises criteria required for grandparent of minor child to petition court for grandparent visitation.

Prohibits processors from selling, preparing, distributing, or exposing for sale certain kratom products & selling, delivering, bartering, furnishing, or giving kratom products to individuals under 21 years of age; revises penalties; provides exception.

bill_title: Management and Storage of Surface Waters
bill_desc: Provides exemption from surface water management & storage regulations for implementation of measures & practices for environmental activities & water quality improvements on specified agricultural lands & government-owned lands; provides condition & requirements for measures & practices; removes requirements for adverse impacts on water resources, certain notification by DEP & water management districts, & activity commencement; prohibits use of exemption for certain mitigation purposes.
Revises requirements for athletic coaches to include certification in cardiopulmonary resuscitation, first aid, & use of automatic external defibrillators.

bill_title: North River Ranch Improvement Stewardship District, Manatee County
bill_desc: Revises boundaries of district.

Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying & location information of appellate court clerks & spouses & children of such appellate court clerks; provides for future legislative review; provides for retroactive application; provides statement of public necessity.

Prohibits trial court judge from accepting specified pleas when person is charged with DUI; requires person to be told that failure to submit to breath or urine test is second degree or first degree misdemeanor; classifies person's refusal to submit to breath or urine test as second degree or first degree misdemeanor; authorizes judicial circuits to create DUI diversion program; requires policies & procedures to be published on state attorney's website; requires each judicial circuit operating such program to submit information to DHSMV for persons who successfully complete program; requires DHSMV to notate successful completion on driving record; provides ineligibility for future participation in program; prohibits court from suspending, deferring, or withholding adjudication of guilt or imposition of sentence for specified violation.

Requires dog owners to securely confine their dogs in proper enclosure; requires dogs subject to dangerous dog investigations be confiscated & held until completion of certain actions; requires animal control to provide information to DACS & destroy certain dogs; requires owner of dangerous dog to obtain liability insurance; revises civil penalty for violations; requires DACS to create statewide Dangerous Dog Registry; revises when owner of dog that has not been declared dangerous is liable for such dog's severe injury to, or death of, human.
Provides enhanced criminal penalties for knowingly sheltering an unmarried minor or aiding an unmarried minor runaway; creates presumption concerning knowledge of minor's age; provides defense.

Requires certain hospitals to make patient's electronic health records available through a specified network directly or through a third-party vendor; requires hospitals & pharmacies to make available specified information for certain purpose.

Proposes amendment to State Constitution to increase period of time during which accrued benefit from specified limitations on homestead property tax assessments may be transferred from prior homestead to new homestead & revising calculation of such transfer.

Revises intent of specified provisions; requires DOC to develop & implement training programs for eligible inmates which include training about restorative justice; revises guideline for providing information concerning services available to victims of crime to include restorative justice; defines "restorative justice."

bill_title: Short-acting Bronchodilator Use in Public and Private Schools
bill_desc: Authorizes certain public & private school students to carry short-acting bronchodilators & components; provides school district, public school, private school, and parental requirements.

Requires state employee health plans & managed care plans under contract with AHCA in Medicaid program to provide coverage for biomarker testing for certain purposes; specifies circumstances under which such overage may be provided; requires clear, convenient, & readily accessible process for authorization requests for biomarker testing; authorizes AHCA to pay for biomarker testing under Medicaid program for specified purposes, subject to specific appropriations; specifies circumstances under which such payments may be made; authorizes AHCA to seek federal approval for biomarker testing payments.

Revises provisions relating to guardianships, visitation rights of minor's or alleged incapacitated person's family, alternatives to guardianship, petitions for appointment of guardian, & verified inventory & annual accounting requirements; requires full reevaluation of need for guardianship after certain time; prohibits judges from overseeing reevaluation proceedings; requires court to impanel jury for certain purpose.

bill_title: Coverage by Citizens Property Insurance Corporation
bill_desc: Revises certain minimum replacement costs as risk amounts ineligible for coverage by Citizens Property Insurance Corporation for personal lines residential structures; provides exceptions to limits on rate increases on single policies issued by corporation.

Requires nursing home facilities to report electronically to AHCA common ownerships facility or its parent company share with certain entities; defines "common ownership"; requires agency to publish on its website specified reports annually; requires agency to annually submit report on success of personal care attendant program to Governor & Legislature.

bill_title: Coverage by the Citizens Property Insurance Corporation
bill_desc: Revises types of policies that go to specified accounts of Citizens Property Insurance Corporation; revises requirements for areas that are eligible for certain personal residential & commercial residential & commercial nonresidential policy coverages by corporation; authorizes corporation to amend wind-eligible areas; authorizes corporation to consider certain factors in developing new eligibility criteria & rates for policies that provide wind-only coverage; provides that such rates are subject to specified provisions; requires corporation to review & submit to Legislature any recommendations to revise certain eligibility criteria for review & approval.

bill_title: The Florida Bright Futures Scholarship Program
bill_desc: Requires public high schools to establish Bright Futures Scholarship mentorship program for students; provides requirements for such program.

Provides that district is dependent special district; removes provisions relating to district's status as independent special district; provides that Okaloosa County Board of County Commissioners or its appointees shall serve as governing board; removes provisions relating to duties, election, terms, compensation, & meetings of district board of commissioners; removes requirement that resolution or ordinance adopted by board & approved by referendum only be repealed by referendum; authorizes district to assess ad valorem taxes & non-ad valorem assessments, & to impose & foreclose non-ad valorem assessment liens, as authorized by law; removes board's authority to enter into certain agreements; revises rate of assessment of non-ad valorem assessments; provides that expansion & merger of district shall be ratified by board.
Revises provisions relating collective bargaining rights, public postsecondary personnel & student rights, & public postsecondary personnel employment & contracts.

bill_title: Display of Flags by Governmental Entities
bill_desc: Prohibits certain governmental entities from erecting or displaying certain flags; requires governmental entity to remain neutral in certain circumstances; provides applicability; requires certain governmental entities to display United States flag in certain position.

Revises provisions relating to teacher & educator preparation programs, educator certification requirements, & educator inservice training requirements to require certified educators to receive training relating to mass casualty incidents.

Requires consumers & dealers to pay deposit fees for specified beverage containers; provides for redemption of beverage containers & refund of deposit fees; authorizes DEP to conduct certain audits; requires notice & provides civil penalties; prohibits local governments from imposing fees for same or similar purpose.
Revises provisions related to Florida Gaming Control Commission; performance schedules & dates; fees & taxes; occupational licenses; operating licenses; unclaimed tickets; & slot machine licenses.
Revises provisions to allow changes to performance dates; revises provisions limiting leasing of pari-mutuel facilities to same class permitholders.
Directs DHSMV to develop Recycle Florida license plate & Boating Capital of the World license plate; provides for distribution & use of fees collected from sale of plates.

Provides that repair & maintenance of specified property is not a change, addition, or improvement under certain circumstances; revises interest rate & penalty that applies to property owners who unlawfully received homestead exemption.

Revises requirements relating to voluntary admissions to facility for examination & treatment, ordering person for involuntary services & treatment, petitions for involuntary service, appointment of counsel, & continuances of hearings; defines "involuntary outpatient placement."

Provides exemption for minors to work in specified conditions; requires counties & municipalities to recognize certain persons as journeymen for specified occupations if such persons meet specified criteria; provides alternative to career fairs through other career & industry networking opportunities; revises provisions relating to revisions to state academic standards, requirements for certain credits & certifications to meet specified graduation requirements; requires DOE to convene workgroup by specified date for specified purposes; provides additional exemption from completing entry-level examination for certain students; creates Career & Technical Education Task Force adjunct to DOE.

bill_title: Artificial Intelligence Use in Political Advertising
