bill_desc: Requires political advertisements, electioneering communications, or other miscellaneous advertisements to include specified disclaimer; subjects person who fails to include disclaimer to civil penalties; authorizes any person to file complaint; provides for expedited hearing.

bill_title: Motor Vehicle Insurance Rates Determination by Zip Codes
bill_desc: Requires DFS to contract with Florida public university to conduct motor vehicle insurance rates as determined by zip codes; provides study's goal; proving reporting requirements.
Revising provisions related to probate records & Florida Uniform Disposition of Community Property Rights at Death Act.
Provides that any person may register to bid & participate in tax certificate sales.

Authorizes program administrator to offer program for financing qualifying improvements for residential or commercial property when authorized by county or municipality; authorizes owner of residential property or commercial property or certain nongovernmental lessees to apply to program administrator to finance qualifying improvement; creates seller's disclosure statements for properties offered for sale which have assessments for qualifying improvements; requires program administrator to confirm that certain conditions are met before disbursing final funds to qualifying improvement contractor for qualifying improvements on residential property; requires program administrator to submit certain certificate to county or municipality upon final disbursement & completion of qualifying improvements; requires county or municipality to establish or approve process for registration of qualifying improvement contractor to install qualifying improvements; requires that, in communicating with property owner or nongovernmental lessee, program administrator, qualifying improvement contractor, or third-party administrator comply with certain requirements; requires contract between property owner or nongovernmental lessee & qualifying improvement contractor to include certain provisions; prohibits program administrator, third-party administrator, or qualifying improvement contractor from providing any cash payment or anything of material value to property owner or nongovernmental lessee which is explicitly conditioned on financing agreement; requires program administrator authorized to administer program for financing qualifying improvement to post on its website annual report; requires auditor general to conduct operational audit of each authorized program.
Revises definition of term "economically disadvantaged" for purposes of school readiness program; & revises provisions relating to school readiness program.

Authorizes school districts & charter schools to adopt policy to allow volunteer school chaplains; requires district school boards & charter school governing boards to assign specified duties to such volunteer school chaplains; requires volunteer school chaplains to meet certain background screening requirements; requires each district school board & charter school to vote by specified date on adoption of school chaplain policy.

Authorizes person to obtain contraceptives & engage in contraception; authorizes health care provider to provide contraceptives, contraception, & contraception-related information; provides requirements for defense to certain violations; authorizes Attorney General, person, or entity to bring enforcement actions under certain circumstances; authorizes civil penalties.
Authorizes advanced practice registered nurses & physician assistants to order or write prescriptions for certain Medicaid services.

Requires local law enforcement agencies to develop policies for local activation of Purple Alert for certain missing adults; specifies requirements; specifies duties of FDLE's Missing Endangered Persons Information Clearinghouse in event of state Purple Alert; specifies conditions under which local law enforcement agency may request clearinghouse to open case.

Revises requirements for payment settlement entities or their electronic payment facilitators in submitting information returns to DOR; prohibits agencies from entering into certain contracts or agreements; requires title to mobile home to be retired if owner of real property records certain documents in official records in county in which real property is located; authorizes insureds & claimants to cancel contracts to replace or repair roof without penalty or obligation within specified timeframe; revises applicability of provisions relating to public adjusters; revises disclosure requirements of contracts for short-term health insurance.

bill_title: Pub. Rec./Department of Financial Services E-Mail Address and Login Credentials
bill_desc: Provides public records exemption for e-mail addresses & secure login credentials obtained by DFS from certain insurance license applications; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

bill_title: Pub. Rec./My Safe Florida Home Program
bill_desc: Provides exemption from public records requirements for certain information contained in applications & home inspection reports submitted by applicants to DFS as part of My Safe Florida Home Program & provides retroactive application.

Requires employers to implement outdoor heat exposure safety program that has been approved by specified departments; specifies requirements for safety program; provides responsibilities for employers & employees; requires specified annual training on heat illness & providing requirements for such training; requires DACS, in conjunction with DOH, to adopt specified rules.

bill_title: Sexual Misconduct Information in Public K-20 Education
bill_desc: Requires district school boards to provide certain information relating to Title IX & sexual misconduct complaints to students, parents, & school employees; requires FCS institutions & state universities to create sexual harassment, sexual assault, dating violence, & stalking policy & comprehensive prevention & outreach program on sexual harassment, sexual assault, dating violence, & stalking & provide certain information to students.

bill_title: Priority Enrollment for Medicaid Home and Community-based Services
bill_desc: Adds specified individuals to list of those who are afforded priority enrollment for Medicaid home & community-based services through long-term care managed care program & do not have to complete screening or wait-list process.

Requires law enforcement officer to provide parent or legal guardian of minor being transported to certain facilities with specified facility information; establishes Office of Children's Behavioral Health Ombudsman within DCF for specified purpose; provides responsibilities of office; requires DCF & managing entities to include specified information in specified manner on their websites.

bill_title: Parenting Plan Recommendations by Court-appointed Psychologists
bill_desc: Revises requirements parent must follow before filing legal action against court-appointed psychologist who developed parenting plan recommendation in certain cases.

Revises provisions to grant psychologists who have met specific criteria established by the Board of Psychology to prescribe drugs and controlled substances; provides board duties regarding recording of psychologists who prescribe controlled substances; requires liability insurance; provisions related to health care insurance claims to provide for prescribing psychologists.
Revises boundaries of Estero Bay Aquatic Preserve.

Provides requirements for involuntary examinations of inmates, placement & treatment of inmate in mental health treatment facility, & filing petitions for involuntary inpatient placement for inmates; provides requirements for emergency & psychotropic medications, use of force, & management & treatment for self-injurious behaviors; requires wardens to consult with inmate's treating physician & make certain determinations; provides for petitions to compel inmate to submit to medical treatment; provides requirements for inmate capacity, health care advance directives, & proxies.

bill_title: Operating Vehicles and Vessels Under the Influence
bill_desc: Revises conditions under which person commits offense of DUI or BUI; provides affirmative defense; revises penalties for offenses of DUI & BUI manslaughter; revises condition that must be met before person arrested for DUI or BUI may be released from custody; authorizes law enforcement witness to give certain testimony; revises conditions that constitute conviction; requires clerk of court to notify FDLE when such conditions have been met; requires FDLE to maintain records thereof; creates rebuttable presumptions; provides additional grounds for issuance of search warrant; revises conditions under which 1 year of probation may be ordered for misdemeanor offenses.
Providing that supervisor of elections may designate additional early voting sites in certain areas.
Requires election board to include members from certain political parties.

Revises boundaries of Lee County Mosquito Control District; abolishes Fort Myers Beach Mosquito Control District; provides for merger of districts; transfers assets & liabilities; requires referendum.

Prohibits holding child transferred to adult court for criminal prosecution in adult facility before hearing; provides exception; removes provisions concerning involuntary mandatory waivers; removes provisions allowing discretionary waivers of children 14 or 15 years of age for specified offenses; removes references to state attorney's discretion to direct file juvenile; revises discretionary direct file criteria; requires court to advise child & his or her parent or guardian of child's right to hearing after information transferring child to adult court is filed; authorizes request for evidentiary hearing; requires hearing within certain time; requires judge to consider specified information & factors; authorizes judge to consider certain reports; provides for continued jurisdiction; requires adult court's order to include certain findings.

bill_title: Employment After Retirement of School District Personnel
bill_desc: Establishes exemption to reemployment after retirement limitation to authorize certain retired staff to be employed in specified positions before meeting definition of termination; prohibits the accrual of additional retirement service credits; requires SBA and DMS to request a certain letter from IRS before implementation.

bill_title: Pension Plan Election under Florida Retirement System
bill_desc: Authorizes certain eligible employees participating in FRS to make second election to move back to pension plan; requires DOR in DMS to notify employees eligible to make such election within specified timeframe; provides requirements for such election; provides that cost of such election is deferred until member's retirement; authorizes such cost to be amortized over certain period of time; prohibits such cost from exceeding specified percentage of member's retirement benefits.

bill_title: Background Screening Requirements for Health Care Practitioners
bill_desc: Expands certain background screening requirements to apply to all health care practitioners; requires health care practitioners licensed before specified date to comply with background screening requirements; revises licensure, registration, or certification requirements to include background screening requirements for specified health care practitioners; provides an appropriation.

Requires OFR to supervise virtual currency kiosk businesses; provides legislative intent; prohibits virtual currency kiosk business from operating without registering; requires certain entities to be licensed as money services businesses; provides that registration is not transferable or assignable; specifies requirements for certain disclosures & attestations; requires registrant to transact business under its legal name; requires registrant to hold new customers' assets in initial transactions in segregated wallets for specified period before initiating transactions; authorizes customers to request refunds during such holding periods; authorizes such customers' assets to be sold at market value & returned to customers; requires certain customers to be queried for specified information; provides criminal penalties.

Prohibits indemnification agreements for errors or omissions relating to preparation of estoppel certificate; specifies acts relating to estoppel certificates for which persons or entities may be disciplined; revises time period in which community association must provide estoppel certificate; removes authorization to charge additional fee; prohibits fees that are not authorized by law; specifies methods for paying fees; removes provisions providing for adjustment of fees based on changes in inflation index.

Requires owner or lessee of proposed vertiport to comply with specified requirements; requires DOT to conduct specified inspection of vertiport; requires DOT to designate subject matter expert for advanced air mobility; provides location & purpose of such expert; provides legislative intent; provides duties of DOT; requires report to Governor & Legislature; provides report requirements; designates Greater Orlando Aviation Authority as advanced air mobility test site for state; revises requirements for adoption of airport land use compatibility zoning regulations.

bill_title: Pub. Rec./Clerks of the Circuit Court, Deputy Clerks, and Clerk Personnel
bill_desc: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying & location information of current clerks of circuit court, deputy clerks of circuit court, & clerk of circuit court personnel & names & personal identifying & location information of spouses & children of such clerks, deputy clerks, & clerk personnel; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides for retroactive application; provides statement of public necessity.

Creates Department of Housing & Tenant Rights; provides for secretary be appointed by Governor & confirmed by Senate; provides purpose of department; requires department submit a report; revises provisions relating to residential tenancies, landlords, & tenants, including requirements for rental agreements, security deposits, notices, evictions, rights to purchase, rent control, impact fees, abandonment of property, & documentary stamp taxes.

Authorizes clerks of circuit court to provide interpretation & translation services; authorizes clerks of circuit court to contract with third-party interpretation service & translation service providers to provide such services in civil actions; provides that provision of such services by clerks of circuit court is ministerial, is authorized court-related function & is allowable expenditure; provides that such services may be made available to party regardless of whether party is represented by counsel; provides that clerks of circuit court are not required to provide interpretation & translation services.

Provides benefits for certain firefighters upon diagnosis of cancer; revises requirements for My Safe Florida Home Program mitigation inspections & mitigation grants; specifies licensed & appointed general lines agents may engage in certain activities while also licensed & appointed as surplus lines agents; provides requirements for certain contracts entered into & purchases made by Florida Joint Underwriting Association, Florida Life & Health Insurance Guaranty Association, board of directors of Florida Health Maintenance Organization Consumer Assistance Plan, & board of directors of Florida Workers' Compensation Insurance Guaranty Association; provides circumstances under which virtual currency held or owing by banking organizations are not presumed unclaimed; provides that certain intangible property held by attorneys in fact & by agents in fiduciary capacity are presumed unclaimed.

bill_title: Pub. Rec./Cellular Telephone Numbers and Secure Login Credentials Held by the Department of Financial Services
bill_desc: Requires DFS to make provisions for certain insurance license applicants to submit cellular telephone numbers for specified purpose; provides public records exemption for cellular telephone numbers & secure login credentials obtained by department through certain insurance license applications; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

bill_title: First Responders and Crime Scene Investigators
bill_desc: Defines "first responder"; provides PTSD suffered by crime scene investigator is compensable occupational disease; authorizes diagnoses be made through telehealth; provides requirements for benefits; requires employing agency to provide mental health training.

bill_title: Civil Actions Involving Assisted Living Facilities
bill_desc: Provides requirements for exclusive cause of action for residents' rights violations or negligence to be brought against specified individuals; provides immunity from liability for certain individuals; prohibits such action from being asserted against certain individuals or entities; revises requirements for recovery of damages & liability for such damages.

bill_title: Expedited Foreclosure Proceedings for Abandoned Real Property
bill_desc: Provides factors for determining if residential real property is vacant; authorizes mortgagee to file motion with court to determine if certain property is abandoned real property; requires mortgagee to provide notice & provides requirements for such notice; requires mortgagee to conspicuously post notice on subject property; specifies time frame in which court can schedule hearing on motion; provides requirements for court.

Creates post-trial counseling program for jurors; requires chief judge of circuit to administer program; requires and authorizes judicial circuit to provide specified number of counseling sessions; authorizes judges to extend jury service for specified administrative purpose if juror requests counseling before conclusion of trial; prohibits clerk of court from releasing name of juror who requests post-trial counseling services; requires judicial circuits to annually submit a report to DCF.

Removes registration fee for certain parties; specifies application of exemption for sales taxes for certain purchasers of boats & aircrafts; specifies that certain purchases are considered single item; authorizes DOR to consider specified requests; authorizes certain parties to include additional specified amounts in garnishment levy notice; revises methods for delivery of levy notices; revises amount of tax that must be paid to be considered compliant with specified statute; authorizes department to adopt emergency rules.

bill_title: Coverage for Orthotics and Prosthetics Services
bill_desc: Authorizes AHCA to pay for specified orthotics & prosthetics services for Medicaid recipients, subject to specific appropriations; requires individual health insurance policies, group, blanket, & franchise health insurance policies, & health maintenance contracts to provide coverage for specified orthotics & prosthetics services; prohibits health insurers & health maintenance organizations from denying claims under certain circumstances; requires health insurers & health maintenance organizations to submit annual reports of specified information to OIR.

Revises percentages of funds to be distributed from Land Acquisition Trust Fund to various trust funds; requires specified amount of funds to be used for Indian River Lagoon Protection Program; provides criteria for disbursement of such funds; requires DEP, using data provided by identified entities, to identify commercial or residential properties that use onsite sewage treatment & disposal systems located within Indian River Lagoon Protection Program; requires DEP to conduct various analyses to determine projects most worthy of state funding; requires DEP to provide annual report that includes prioritized list of onsite sewage treatment & disposal systems eligible for state funding to Legislature & certain chairs within specified timeframe.

Requires nicotine products manufacturers to execute & deliver form to Division of Alcoholic Beverages & Tobacco of DBPR for each product sold within this state; requires division to develop & maintain directory listing certified nicotine products manufacturers & certified nicotine products; subjects retail & wholesale nicotine products dealers to inspections; requires manufacturers & dealers of nicotine products to maintain certain records; prohibits sale, shipment, or distributing of certain nicotine products into this state; requires persons or entities that seek to deal or sell certain nicotine products or dispensing devices to retail dealers to obtain wholesale nicotine products dealer permit; requires wholesale nicotine products dealer permitholders to sell only nicotine products listed in division's directory; provides that holders of wholesale nicotine products dealer permit must consent to certain inspections without warrant; provides for seizure & destruction of unlawful nicotine products.

Requires each provider of earned wage access services to register with FSC; provides registration requirements; specifies mechanisms by which registrations can be denied, not renewed, or revoked; provides requirements provider registered to provide earned wage access services must comply with; specifies prohibited acts; specifies interplay between earned wage access services provided by provider & operation of other state laws related to those services; provides administrative remedies & penalties.

bill_title: Mass Shootings and Acts of Terrorism
bill_desc: Revises prohibition on making threats to conduct mass shooting or act of terrorism to include audio & video telephones; prohibits planning to conduct mass shooting or an act of terrorism; specifies what constitutes plan to conduct mass shooting or an act of terrorism.
Authorizes SBA & affiliated limited liability entities to issue securities & borrow money through specified means, subject to specified limitations.

Prohibits insurers from cancelling & nonrenewing certain personal residential & commercial residential property insurance policies for specified period; provides requirements for averaged models if such models are used for insurance rates; revises property insurance policies issued by Citizens Property Insurance Corporation which are not subject to rate increase limitations; provides requirements for surplus for reciprocal insurers; requires that reciprocal certificates of authority be issued to certain entities; authorizes reciprocal insurers to borrow money for specified purposes; prohibits specified acquisitions of certain voting securities; provides that votes in contravention of specified provisions are not valid; provides that acquisitions contrary to specified provisions are void; authorizes office to order certain persons to cease acquisition & divest themselves of stocks & ownership interests; prohibits Florida state security & guaranty funds from covering performance of contractual obligations of exchanges & their members for certain provisions relating to reciprocal insurer surpluses & attorney bonds.

Creates Property Insurance Commission; provides powers & duties of commission & election of Commissioner of Insurance Regulation; prohibits commissioner from engaging in certain activities or employment after leaving office; requires interest earned on insurance proceeds be paid to insureds; specifies condition on insurance activities engaged in within this state by person who engages in property insurance activities in another state; prohibits property insurers from using certain defenses for denial of claims; requires DFS to adopt rules regarding its handling of allegations of insurance fraud made by insurers or their employees or contractors; specifies appropriations for My Safe Florida Home Program.

Removes religious colleges from list of institutions specified as not being under jurisdiction or purview of Commission for Independent Education; provides requirements for nonpublic religious postsecondary educational institutions relating to licensure, Commission for Independent Education, & certain religious nongovernmental education associations that cooperate with commission for specified purposes.

Provides requirements & penalties for community association managers & management firms relating to conflicts of interest; revises & provides provisions relating to condominium & cooperative associations, including reporting requirements, financial reports, unit owner & board meetings, director education, criminal activity & penalties, legal actions, notices, & auditing; requires Division of Florida Condominiums, Time Shares, & Mobile Homes to submit report to Governor & Legislature.

Provides an exception to general law; limits compensation to health care provider that provides medical services for inmate housed in St. Lucie County detention center if provider does not have contract with county to provide such services; limits compensation to entity that provides emergency medical transportation services for inmate housed in St. Lucie County detention center if entity does not have contract with county to provide such services.

bill_title: Municipal Service District of Ponte Vedra Beach, St. Johns County
bill_desc: Revises provisions relating to terms of office of District Trustees; revises capital expenditure amount required to be approved by voters of district; revises authority of district to approve such expenditure; revises limitation on amount of district's contingency reserves.
Creates Single-Sex Student Organizations' Bill of Rights; provides requirements for institutions of higher education & single-sex student organizations; providing penalties.

bill_title: My Safe Florida Condominium Pilot Program
bill_desc: Establishes My Safe Florida Condominium Pilot Program within DFS; provides requirements for DFS, wind certification entities, hurricane mitigation inspectors & inspections, inspection & grant applications, mitigation grant eligibility, grant matching & maximum grant amount, mitigation projects & use of grant funds, contracts, & annual report.
Provides exception from specified provisions for telemarketers & sellers who provide debt relief services.
Revises provisions concerning specified activities involving iguanas; prohibits pet stores from selling or offering for sale domestic dogs & cats.

Requires Florida Commission on Offender Review to develop & maintain database containing certain information; repeals provisions relating to Office of Election Crimes & Security & prohibition on use of private funds for election-related expenses; prohibits certain governmental entities from taking certain actions relating to elections; establishes Florida Voting Rights Act Commission; requires commission to designate certain languages for which assistance in voting & elections must be provided in certain circumstances; requires commission to enter into agreement to create Florida Voting & Elections Database & Institute; provides that enactment or implementation of certain policies by covered jurisdiction is subject to preclearance by commission; authorizes court to order certain appropriate remedies; authorizes certain persons to register to vote & immediately thereafter cast vote in certain circumstances authorizes DHSMV to preregister certain individuals to vote; revises provisions relating to third-party voter registration organizations & vote-by-mail ballots; establishes General Election Day as paid holiday; repeals prohibition on ranked-choice voting; authorizes certain persons to file certain civil actions.

Requires person who uses motor vehicle to transport children to equip such motor vehicle with alarm system that prompts driver to inspect motor vehicle for unattended occupants before exiting; requires DHSMV to initiate public awareness campaign regarding alarm systems; requires DHSMV to maintain list of approved alarm manufacturers & alarm systems; revises transportation safety minimum standards for licensure of child care facilities.

bill_title: Court-ordered Sealing of Criminal History Records
bill_desc: Revises eligibility criteria for criminal record sealing; provides for additional record sealings.

Revises eligibility requirements for review of sentences for offenses committed while juvenile; revises duties of DOC concerning reviews; revises procedures for initiating review; provides for appointment of counsel; provides requirements for hearings; requires court to render written ruling; requires court to consider specified additional factors; requires annual report; provides for retroactive application.

bill_title: Premises Liability for Third Party Acts
bill_desc: Revises provisions relating to premises liability for certain acts of third parties; requires trier of fact in action for damages brought against certain persons by or on behalf of person injured by intentional tort of third party to consider fault of all persons who are alleged to have contributed to injury.

Authorizes charter & private schools to install & operate school bus infraction detection system; revises required uses for civil penalties assessed & collected for violations; prohibits school bus infraction detection systems from being used for remote surveillance; revises purposes for which video & images recorded as part of school bus infraction detection system may be used; provides school safety officer who completes training may be authorized as traffic infraction enforcement officer & may issue notices & citations.

bill_title: Home and Community-based Services Medicaid Waiver Program
bill_desc: Requires APD to develop & implement automated, electronic application process for specified services; provides requirements for application process; requires agency to provide application in printed form or portable document format under certain circumstances; requires agency to make eligibility determination in specified amount of time for certain persons; authorizes agency to request additional documentation under certain circumstances; provides requirements for such request; provides requirements for AHCA when client's iBudget is established; requires agency within specified time period to ensure certain services that client has applied for have begun.

bill_title: Flood Disclosure in the Sale of Real Property
bill_desc: Requires seller of residential real property to provide specified information to a prospective purchaser; specifies how such information must be disclosed.

Prohibits governmental entity from inhibiting construction of housing for agricultural workers on certain agricultural land; provides requirements for construction or installation of specified housing; requires local ordinances comply with certain regulations; authorizes adoption of local land use regulations that are less restrictive than certain state & federal regulations; provides requirements for record maintenance; provides for the suspension & removal of use of certain housing units; specifies applicability of certain permit allocation systems; authorizes continued use of certain housing sites constructed if certain conditions are met.

bill_title: Location of Medical Marijuana Centers, Retail Vape Shops, and On-premises Consumption of Alcohol
bill_desc: Revises authorized distance between location of certain medical marijuana treatment centers & specified religious or educational institutions upon specified date; specifies authorized distance between location of retail vape shops & specified religious or educational institutions upon specified date; revises authorized distance between location of businesses that allow on-premises consumption of alcoholic beverages & specified religious or educational institutions upon specified date; removes local governments' ability to approve such location for specified purposes.

bill_title: Property Insurance Rebate Program for Low-income Seniors
bill_desc: Creates program within DFS to provide property insurance rebate for low-income seniors; provides eligibility requirements to receive rebate under program; authorizes eligible persons to apply to program if certain documentation & proof are provided; specifies calculation of rebate & procedures for disbursing funds; provides appropriation.

bill_title: Liability on Optional Motor Vehicle Equipment
bill_desc: Provides that there is no obligation or duty to retrofit motor vehicle with component parts or equipment in certain circumstances; provides that certain evidence is inadmissible in civil litigation.
Provides nonrefundable fees for registration, registration renewal, & late registration renewal applications as virtual currency kiosk businesses; provides that registration fees are not prorated.

Revises requirements for contracts DCF has with community-based care lead agencies; provides duties for board members of lead agencies; prohibits lead agency from entering into contract or being party to transaction that creates conflict of interest; imposing civil penalties on lead agencies for undisclosed conflicts of interest; requires contracts to be reprocured; provides tiered payment model; requires DCF to impose penalties for lead agency's noncompliance with applicable procurement law; requires DCF to retain all rights to & ownership of real property procured upon termination of contracts.

Authorizes chiropractic physicians to use dry needling treatments for specified purposes; requires Board of Chiropractic Medicine to certify certain applicants who provide specified credentials evaluation report.

Eliminates certain tax liabilities imposed on certified recovery residences; provides levels of care at certified recovery residences & their respective levels of care for residents; defines "community housing"; revises membership of Statewide Council on Opioid Abatement.

bill_title: Postsecondary Students Who Are Homeless or At Risk of Homelessness
bill_desc: Revises provisions relating to services & information provided to & for students experiencing or at risk of experiencing homelessness; establishes Fostering Independence Grant Program within DOE to be administered by FCS institutions & state universities; provides requirements for program.

Revises application requirements for nursing education programs; requires, rather than authorizes, certain degree requirements to be documented in specified manner; requires each program director to submit annual report & written remediation plan to Board of Nursing; requires board to deny application under certain circumstances; authorizes board to revoke approval of specified existing programs; requires board to terminate program under certain circumstances; authorizes certain DOH agents & employees to conduct onsite evaluations & inspections; authorizes DOH to collect evidence; revises rulemaking authority; removes provisions authorizing extension of program's probationary status.

bill_title: Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
bill_desc: Revises, repeals, & creates various provisions relating to electric vehicle charging stations; pest control & fumigation; commercial landscaping & wildlife management; weapons & firearms; charitable organizations & professional solicitors; cultivated meat & saw palmetto berries; motor vehicle repair shops; direct support organizations; Florida Agricultural Museum; trespass on & theft of property; weights & measures; household moving & shipping services; agricultural school activities; hunter ID program; & penalties for various violations.

Revises entities to & purposes for which water quality enhancement credits may be sold; requires DEP & water management districts to authorize such sale & use; authorizes governmental entities to solicit private-sector proposals for mitigation banks on public lands; provides requirements for DEP & water management districts in assigning credits to such mitigation banks.

Dissolving specified soil & water conservation districts & transferring district assets & liabilities to DACS & specified counties; revises, creates, & repeals various provisions for soil & water conservation districts relating to Soil & Water Conservation Council, regional soil & water conservation districts, district board supervisors, district governing boards, & reassignment of assets of certain dissolved districts.

Revises fund into which moneys recovered by certain state attorneys & public defenders or regional counsels must be remitted; revises entity that funds capital collateral regional counsel; revises allocation of filing fees for certain trial & appellate proceedings; provides additional duties of Florida Clerks of Court Operations Corporation; requires Corporation to calculate certain excesses collected from fines, fees, service charges & costs; authorizes Corporation to submit requests for reimbursement; removes provision requiring each state attorney to publish annual report addressing affirmative action program; revises distribution of certain civil penalty amounts & administrative fees; creates Clerk of Court Driver License Reinstatement Pilot Program; revises funds into which certain moneys received by state attorneys must be deposited; removes provision authorizing certain clerks of circuit courts to request reimbursement for certain petitions related to domestic violence, repeat, sexual, or dating violence & stalking.

Provides that only coastal counties & coastal municipalities that received written authorization from DEP may establish construction zoning & building code exceptions to coastal construction control lines; prohibits DEP from delegating authority to coastal counties & coastal municipalities that did not receive such authorization; authorizes DEP to award grants to coastal counties for certain saltwater intrusion vulnerability assessments & provide certain cost-share funding; requires DEP to update certain data & make certain information available on its website.

Requires certain counties to use revenue received from tourist development tax in specified manner; requires that charter county convention development moneys be distributed to certain entities for specified purposes; deletes specified notification requirement.

Revises & creates provisions relating to dependent children, including criminal history records checks, removing children from court-ordered placement, evidence required to amend case plans, Guardianship Assistance Program, notice requirements, review of DCF denial of application to adopt, home studies, adoption assistance services, & photo listing component of statewide adoption exchange.

Revises required instruction in Life skills that build confidence, support mental & emotional health, & enable students to overcome challenges to include career readiness, financial literacy, & home economics.

bill_title: Storage of Firearms in Motor Vehicles or Vessels
bill_desc: Provides requirements for storage of firearms in motor vehicles or vessels.
Redefining criteria for membership in FRS Special Risk Class.

Provides for creation of Gulf Coast Transit Authority; provides boundaries; provides for charter amendments; board of directors, membership, powers, functions, & duties of board; provides powers, functions, & duties of authority; authorizes authority to levy & enforce collection of non-ad valorem assessments; prohibits authority from having ad valorem taxing power; authorizes authority to borrow money; provides for bonds; provides for use of authority funds; provides exemptions from taxes & assessments upon certain properties & revenues; provides requirements for recordkeeping & public meetings & records; authorizes board to adopt policies & regulations.

bill_title: Florida Uniform Fiduciary Income and Principal Act
bill_desc: Revises provisions of Florida Uniform Principal & Income Act governing trusts, estates, life estates, & other term interests.

Specifies penalties for subsequent violations against certain persons who smoke or vape near school property; specifies penalties for subsequent violations against certain persons who possess nicotine products.

bill_title: Deferred Retirement Option Program Eligibility for School Employees and Personnel
bill_desc: Removes the time limitation for DROP eligibility for certain personnel.

Requires food delivery platforms to disclose information & provide notice to consumer; authorizes Division of Hotels & Restaurants of DBPR to issue to food delivery platform notice to cease & desist for specified violations; requires division to provide food delivery platform ability to cure any violation within specified timeframe before enforcing such notice or imposing civil penalty; authorizes division to enforce such notice through specified legal proceedings & to collect attorney fees & costs; authorizes division to impose civil penalty; authorizes division to receive & investigate complaints of specified violations; preempts regulation of food service platforms to state.

Expands list of acceptable forms of identification for voter registration applicants to include U.S. passport, identification cards issued by federally recognized tribal nation or Indian tribe, & United States Merchant Mariner Credentials; requires driver licenses issued to drivers denote certain individuals as noncitizens.

Proposes amendments to State Constitution to allow newly established homestead property to be assessed at less than just value if the property was previously assessed as nonhomestead property and has not changed ownership and authorizing residency requirements for homestead exemptions be provided by general law.
Authorizes certain taxpayers to rescind homestead exemption applications; provides requirements for such action; requires property appraiser to adjust tax roll.

Provides & revises provisions related to the Beverage Law, including definitions, requirements for certain manufacturers of malt beverages, craft breweries, & contract brewing & alternating proprietorship brewing.

bill_title: Security for Jewish Day Schools and Preschools
bill_desc: Requiring DOE to establish program to provide funds to Jewish day schools & preschools for specified security purposes; provides authorized uses for such funds.

Authorizes clerk of court to accept monthly installment payments for administrative processing charge; revises methods by which clerk may accept payments for fees, charges, costs, & fines; provides requirements for payment plan; authorizes court to modify payment plan or reduce, waive, or convert to community service outstanding fees, costs, or fines; prohibits clerk from sending incarcerated individual's account to collection agency or sending notice to DHSMV to suspend incarcerated individual's driver license; revises offenses that would lead to suspension of driver license upon failure to comply with court directives.

bill_title: Use of Lights and Sirens on Emergency Vehicles
bill_desc: Authorizes driver of authorized emergency vehicle to exercise certain privileges when transporting organs or surgical teams for organ donation or transplant to certain locations; authorizes authorized emergency vehicles to operate emergency lights & sirens in emergency; authorizes organ transport vehicles to show or display red lights; authorizes organ transport vehicle to display or use red warning signals.

bill_title: Three Rivers Stewardship District, Sarasota County
bill_desc: Revises boundaries of district.

bill_title: City of North Port, Sarasota County
bill_desc: Creates Star Farms Village at North Port Stewardship District; establishes boundaries; provides for board of supervisors & election, membership, terms, meetings, & duties of board; provides method for transition of board from landowner control to control by resident electors; provides for district manager & treasurer; provides general & special powers of district; provides for bonds, borrowing, future ad valorem taxation, special assessments, issuance of certificates of indebtedness, & tax liens; provides for fees & charges; provides for referendum.

bill_title: Flood Zone Disclosures for Dwelling Units
bill_desc: Requires landlords to make specified disclosures relating to flood zones before commencement of tenancy; requires landlords to notify current tenants of change in dwelling unit's flood zone designation.

Creates Legislative Compensation Advisory Council; requires OLS to provide administrative support; provides purpose of council; provides for membership of council; prohibits certain council members from being current member of & Legislature, current employee of Legislature, or registered lobbyist; requires council to hold its first meeting by specified date & to hold periodic meetings thereafter; authorizes members to attend meetings through communications media technology; provides duties of council; requires council to submit specified report to Legislature by specified date & biennially thereafter.

Revises upward penalties associated with selling alcoholic beverages without license; provides for additional criminal penalties for subsequent violations; specifies conditions under which sites that have violated prohibition on unlawful sale of alcoholic beverages may be declared public nuisance.

bill_title: Economic Development in Gaming Concentrated Counties
bill_desc: Creating Prospect Del Vista, Inc. as nonprofit corporation which is not unit or entity of state government; requires Prospect Del Vista, Inc., to create & administer investment fund for certain purpose in certain manner; requires Prospect Del Vista, Inc., to establish trust account for certain purpose; provides that Prospect Del Vista, Inc., is subject to certain public records & meetings requirements; providing for board of directors of Prospect Del Vista, Inc.; authorizes Prospect Del Vista, Inc., to make certain awards to certain projects or programs; requires scope of certain audits to include funds awarded by Prospect Del Vista, Inc.

Removes requirement that certain permitholders show that their permits have not been disapproved or recalled at later election when submitting subsequent annual applications to Florida Gaming Control Commission; authorizes certain greyhound dogracing permitholders to relocate; specifies areas to which permitholder may not relocate; provides that certain pari-mutuel facilities are not subject to municipal restrictions on establishment of such facilities; requires that slot machine gaming area of relocated pari-mutuel facility be at location for which relocation was approved; provides that pari-mutuel facilities that relocated in accordance with act are not subject to municipal restrictions on establishment of cardrooms.

Requires manufacturers of tablets or smartphones to manufacture such devices so that filter is enabled upon activation; provides for enforcement; provides civil liability for individuals who enable password to remove filter on device in possession of minor; increases criminal penalties for certain offenses; prohibits persons who are of at least specified age from knowingly engaging in communication that is part of pattern of communication or behavior that meets specified criteria.

Creates Online Sting Operations Grant Program within FDLE to support local law enforcement agencies in creating sting operations to protect children; requires FDLE to annually award grant funds; provides funding requirements.

Requires person who commits moving violation that causes serious bodily injury to or death of vulnerable road user to pay specified fine & attend driver improvement course; requires DHSMV to revoke person's driver license for specified period.
Creates offense of lewd or lascivious grooming.

Requires collection & sharing of data between multiple agencies for interagency cooperative agreement; provides requirements for accountability measures; requires Office of Reimagining Education & Career Help to issue annual statewide report each year.

bill_title: Required Instruction in History of African Americans
bill_desc: Revises required instruction in history of African Americans to include comprehensive account of sociopolitical circumstances surrounding slavery.
Prohibits any increase in millage rate from going into effect until it has been approved by specified vote.

Provides for home inspections for flood damage under My Safe Florida Home Program; requires DFS to contract with flood certification entities to provide mitigation inspections; provides requirements for flood certification entities to qualify for selection by department; provides requirements for flood mitigation grants; authorizes flood mitigation inspectors to participate as mitigation contractors under program; requires matching fund grants to be made available to certain entities for projects that reduce flood damage.
Urges Congress to impel United States National Guard Bureau to examine resource allocations of Florida National Guard & allow increase in its force structure.
Extends expiration date of certain promotional rate.

bill_title: Policy Cancellations and Nonrenewals by Property Insurers
bill_desc: Prohibits authorized insurers & eligible surplus lines insurers from canceling & nonrenewing within certain timeframes policies covering dwellings & residential properties damaged by hurricanes & wind losses; provides exceptions to prohibitions against insurers' policy cancellations & nonrenewals within certain timeframes; authorizes FSC to adopt rules & Commissioner of Insurance Regulation to issue orders.

bill_title: Stanley G. Tate Florida Prepaid College Program
bill_desc: Revises definition of term "tuition differential"; beginning in specified academic year, revising which advanced contracts certain provisions apply to; revises certain purchase date requirements for advance placement contracts for specified purposes within program.

Requires DEP, in consultation with water management districts & sewage disposal facilities, to submit to Governor & Legislature reports on permitted sewage disposal facilities in state, priority ranking process for implementing advanced wastewater treatment upgrades at such facilities & implementation status of such upgrades.

Establishes Florida State Psychiatric Hospital in specified location to provide specialized care for specified individuals; requires hospital to establish admittance program for specified individuals; provides requirements for length of individual's stay; provides hospital & its admittance program operate in conjunction with specified laws; prohibits program from being used for specified individuals; requires DOH, in conjunction with DCF, to jointly oversee implementation & administration of program.
Authorizes school's board of trustees to change name of school.

Directs DACS to implement pilot program to provide incentives to food recovery entities to negotiate price for fresh food products; provides shipping requirements; authorizes food recovery entities to reject certain fresh food products; requires DACS to reimburse food recovery entities for certain costs; provides reimbursement requirements; requires DACS to submit reports to Governor & Legislature; provides for expiration of pilot program; provides appropriation.

bill_title: Verification of Eligibility for Homestead Exemption
bill_desc: Requires DOR to provide form for specified purpose; authorizing property appraisers to provide tentative verification of eligibility for specified exemptions & discounts; requires such form to indicate specified information; prohibits specified decisions from certain review.

Revises qualification requirements person must meet in order to take water well contractor license examination; prohibits person or business entity from advertising water well drilling or construction services in specified circumstances; requires rules adopted by DEP relating to location of onsite sewage treatment & disposal systems allow licensed water well contractor to apply for & receive variance for installation of private or public potable water well; provides DEP's variance review & advisory committee is not responsible for reviewing water well permitting; requires committee to consider certain requirements when making recommendations on variance requests.

Transfers real property from Board of Trustees of Internal Improvement Trust Fund to Town Council of Town of Sneads; provides requirements for use & sale or disposition of real property; requires conveyance of real property by specified date.

bill_title: Attorney Fees and Costs in Property Rights Disputes
bill_desc: Authorizes courts to award reasonable attorney fees & costs to prevailing defendant in certain civil actions.

bill_title: Coordinated Systems of Care for Children
bill_desc: Requires certain school districts to adhere to specified mental health & treatment support system for certain children & meet specified performance outcomes; requires each school district to report annually to DOE on certain outcomes & funding.

Provides for reclassification of certain offenses when committed against persons 65 years of age or older, against minors, or against persons with disabilities; provides for civil actions for damages by persons whose image or likeness was used in scheme to defraud with their consent.

Authorizes Medicaid to reimburse for dental services provided by certain mobile dental units; creates Council on Dental Therapy; specifies licensure requirements, services, limitations, & prohibitions relating to practice of dental therapy; requires DOH, in consultation with Board of Dentistry & AHCA, to submit reports to Legislature.
Revises judicial retention question that appears on ballot to include name of Governor who appointed justice or judge.

Revises scope of power & responsibility of municipalities & counties under Community Planning Act; clarifies circumstances under which local government or special district must credit contributions toward collection of impact fee; removes exemption of water & sewer connection fees from Florida Impact Fee Act; revises exceptions from provisions governing credits against local impact fees; revises procedures regarding local government review of changes to previously approved developments of regional impact; specifies changes that are not subject to local government review; specifies that certain changes to comprehensive plan policies & land development regulations do not apply to proposed changes to approved development of regional impact or to development orders required to implement approved development of regional impact.

Requires court's consideration of specified conflicts of interest; prohibits specified acts by litigation financiers; requires disclosures & discovery relating to litigation financing agreements; requires indemnification of specified fees, costs, & sanctions; voids certain litigation financing agreements; provides for enforcement of specified violations under Florida Deceptive & Unfair Trade Practices Act.

Revises penalties for minors committing firearms violations; redesignates civil citation programs as delinquency citation programs; requires child on probation for felony firearm offense who is taken into custody be placed in secure detention; requires specified sanctions for certain children adjudicated for firearms offenses; requires DJJ to create graduated response matrix to hold youths accountable for probation & conditional release terms; authorizes exception to revocation or suspension of driving privileges in certain circumstances; requires DJJ to establish specified class for firearms offenders; revises provisions concerning introduction of contraband into DJJ facilities.

bill_title: Florida Main Street Program and Historic Preservation Tax Credits
bill_desc: Specifies eligibility requirements for receiving specified tax credits for taxpayers that rehabilitate certified historic structures; specifies requirements for DOR relating to applications & credits; specifies requirements for such tax credits; authorizes carryforward, sale, & transfer of tax credits; provides limitation; revises order in which tax credits against corporate income tax credit or franchise tax are applied; revises order in which tax credits & deductions against insurance premium tax are applied.

bill_title: Thermal Efficiency Standards for Unvented Attic and Unvented Enclosed Rafter Assemblies
bill_desc: Provides that certain unvented attic & unvented enclosed rafter assemblies meet requirements of Florida Building Code, Energy Conservation.

Creates Carbon Sequestration Task Force adjunct to DEP; provides for task force membership & duties; requires task force to submit specified reports to Secretary of Environmental Protection & Governor & Legislature by specified dates; provides appropriation.

Provides defective corporate action is not void or voidable in certain circumstances; requires board of directors to take action to ratify defective corporate action; provides quorum & voting requirements for ratification of defective corporate actions; requires notice be given to shareholders of corporate action taken by board of directors; requires corporations to file articles of validation; provides registered agent may resign from companies by delivering specified statement of resignation to DOS; provides registered agents may pay one resignation fee regardless of whether resigning from one or multiple dissolved companies or corporations.

bill_title: Assignment of Benefits for Surplus Lines Insurers
bill_desc: Provides that prohibition against assignment of post-loss insurance benefits applies to residential & commercial property insurance policies issued by authorized insurers & eligible surplus lines insurers on or after specified date.

bill_title: Financial Accountability in Publicly Funded Education
bill_desc: Revises requirements for private school to participate in certain educational scholarship programs; requires DOE to suspend payment of funds to participating private schools; creates K-12 Education Funding Task Force within DOE; & provides requirements for task force.
Prohibits certain increases in millage rate from going into effect until it has been approved by specified vote.

bill_title: Early Child Care Universal Voucher Program
bill_desc: Establishes Early Child Care Universal Voucher Program; & provides program, funding, ELC, DOE, provider, student, & parent requirements.

Creates Division of Labor Standards for specified purposes; designates division as state Agency for Workforce Innovation for purposes of implementing s. 24, Art. X of State Constitution; revises provisions relating to state minimum wage including, protected rights, prohibition on certain contracts, process for filing complaint, statute of limitations during investigation, liability & recordkeeping; creates the Division of Labor Standards Community Advisory Board; provides for membership, meetings & duties of board; requires annual report.

Requires research facilities to offer certain dogs & cats for adoption to societies or associations before euthanizing such dogs & cats; authorizes facilities to enter into collaborative agreements; provides immunity from liability for research facilities acting in good faith; requires certain publicly funded institutions report concerning animal testing activities; provides requirements for report.

Revises provisions relating to homeowners' associations including standards for officers, directors, or managers of HOA; detailed accountings; the provision of HOA's rules & covenants to members; fines and suspensions; attorney fees and costs; priority of payments; liens; appeals of certain decisions; prohibited clauses in association documents; & assessments.

Creates advisory council within OIR for specified purposes; provides for membership & meetings of advisory council; requires OIR to provide advisory council with staffing & administrative assistance; requires advisory council to submit specified report annually; provides for expiration of advisory council.
Provides requirements for operators of vacation rentals that have swimming pools; provides certain notice requirements.

bill_title: Disassociation from Council on American-Islamic Relations
bill_desc: Strongly encouraging all state executive agencies, all law enforcement agencies, & all local governments in this state to suspend contact & outreach activities with Council on American-Islamic Relations.

Requires executive agencies to annually upload report to specified website maintained by EOG; provides requirements for such report; provides that specified provisions are subject to repeal unless reviewed & saved from repeal by Legislature.

bill_title: Windstorm Coverage by Citizens Property Insurance Corporation
bill_desc: Removes provisions relating to windstorm risk apportionment plan agreements among property insurers; requires Citizens Property Insurance Corporation to make windstorm coverage available to homeowners for any residential structures & commercial lines residential structures; provides underwriting & administering requirements for windstorm coverage portion of insurance.
Revises requirements for packaging & labeling of edibles.
Provides scheduled increase in maximum payment amounts that may be made from recovery fund for Division I & Division II individual & aggregate claims.
Revises provisions related to dental insurance claims, including payment methods, notifications, fees, powers of OIR & FSC, denial of claims, & contracts.

Revises types of data that comprehensive plans & plan amendments must be based on; revises means by which application of methodology used in data collection or whether particular methodology is professionally accepted & evaluated; revises elements that must be included in comprehensive plan; revises criteria for adopting small scale development amendment; revises content requirements for local land development regulations; revises mechanisms by which applications for infill development must be administratively approved.

bill_title: Minimum Age for Firearm Purchase or Transfer
bill_desc: Reducing minimum age at which person may purchase firearm & age of purchasers to which specified licensees are prohibited from selling or transferring firearm.
Removes requirement that Florida Commission on Human Relations send certain information to certain persons by registered mail.
Designates Tuskegee Airmen Commemoration Day, which occurs on fourth Thursday in March, as legal holiday.

bill_title: Termination of Easements and Related Rights or Interests for Affordable Housing Development
bill_desc: Requires local assistance plans to authorize termination of easements or rights, interests, or servitudes in nature of easements for use of or access to lake & its upland banks in specified circumstances to develop affordable housing; provides termination method; requires recording of specified notice in public records; requires recording of specified final orders & instruments in public records.

Provides for protected series of series limited liability company & foreign protected series of foreign series limited liability company; provides for nature, governing law, operating agreement, registered agent, service, certificates, associated assets, associated members, protected series transferable interest, management, liabilities, remedies, enforcement of judgments against, dissolution, & merger & applicability of laws to such companies & protected series of such companies.

Defines terms relating to sex of individual in context of construction of Florida Statutes; provides that certain birth certificate statement determines whether person is male or female & may serve as committeeman or committeewoman, respectively; revises provisions related to applications for disability ID cards, application requirements for driver licenses & ID cards to replace references to term "gender" with term "sex"; prohibits DHSMV from issuing original or replacement driver licenses or ID cards that contain specified information; requires individual health insurance policies, group health insurance policies, health benefit plans, & health maintenance contracts that provide coverage for sex-reassignment prescriptions or procedures must also provide coverage for treatment to detransition from such sex-reassignment prescriptions or procedures; defines term "sex" for purposes of Florida Civil Rights Act; revises provisions related to remedies for unlawful discrimination to include protection on basis of sex, rather than gender.

Revises reporting requirements; specifies criteria applicable for removal of status for certain persons; revises registration requirements; revises provisions relating to verification; revises penalties.

Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying & location information of current or former medical examiners & names & personal identifying & location information of spouses & children of such medical examiners; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides for retroactive application; provides statement of public necessity.

Prohibits counties & municipalities from restricting floor area ratio of proposed developments; authorizes counties & municipalities to restrict height of proposed developments; prohibits administrative approval by counties & municipalities of proposed development within specified proximity to military installation; revises conditions for when multifamily projects are considered property used for charitable purpose & are eligible for ad valorem property tax exemption; revises condition of eligibility for vacant residential units to qualify for certain ad valorem property tax exemption; removes required working hours under Florida Hometown Hero Program; specifies conditions under which corporation may preclude applicants from corporation programs; provides appropriation.

Revises sentencing score sheet to reflect that that no community sanction points are assessed in certain circumstances; revises sanctions for probations violations; provides for hearings within specified time period for low-risk probation or community control violations; provides for release of offender in certain circumstances if hearing is not held; provides for nonmonetary conditions of release.

Provides requirements for certain community association managers & firms; provides & revises requirements for association's official records; requires association to assist in law enforcement investigation as allowed by law; requires that certain associations use independent certified public accountant to prepare its annual budget; requires certain associations to retain attorney for certain purposes; revises requirements for director education; provides criminal penalties for certain actions by officer, director, or manager of association; requires certain standards be applied & enforced reasonably & equitably; requires certain written notice to parcel owners.

Authorizes certain individuals to use title "veterinary professional associate"; authorizes such associates to perform certain duties & actions; prohibits such associates from prescribing certain drugs or controlled substances or performing surgical procedures; provides exceptions; provides that veterinarians are liable for acts or omissions of veterinary professional associates under their supervision & control.

bill_title: Joint Session for Purpose of Receiving Governor's Message
bill_desc: Provides that the House of Representatives and the Senate convene in Joint Session for the purpose of receiving a message from the Governor.

bill_title: Condominiums Within a Portion of a Building or Within a Multiple Parcel Building
bill_desc: Provides condominium may be created within portion of building or multiple parcel building; provides for common elements of such condominium; provides requirements for declaration of condominium; authorizes association to inspect and copy books & records & receive annual budget; requires specified statements & disclosures to purchasers of condominium units; provides multiple parcel building is not subdivision of land if land is not subdivided.
Proposes amendment to State Constitution to authorize Legislature to exempt tangible personal property located on land classified agricultural from ad valorem taxation.

Requires CFO to set rate of interest payable by eligible institutions on interest on trust accounts quarterly, effective on specified dates; provides that percentage yield of such rate may not exceed specified threshold; requires CFO to inform Funding Florida Legal Aid of rate established for quarter; authorizes eligible institutions to pay annual percentage yield that is greater of specified interest rates or dividends on specified accounts; requires that such institutions submit to Funding Florida Legal Aid certain form promulgated by The Florida Bar.

Revises criminal penalties for false or fraudulent acknowledgements; removes civil penalty relating to provision that prohibits notary public from notarizing signature on document of person who is not, at time of notarial act, physically present or present by means of audio-video communication technology; provides criminal penalties.

bill_title: Division of Florida Condominiums, Timeshares, and Mobile Homes
bill_desc: Transfers division to DLA by type two transfer by specified date; requires DBPR & DLA to enter into memorandum of agreement by specified date; requires DLA to develop rules & procedures for resolving certain disputes to include all possible means of alternative dispute resolution.
Requires AHCA to adopt rules that allow Level I Adult Cardiovascular Services program to use certain tools & treatments.
Encourages International Olympic Committee to recognize Haudenosaunee Nationals as independent lacrosse team and allow team to participate in 2028 Olympic Games in Los Angles, California.

Revises provisions related to My Safe Florida Home Program including legislative intent, eligibility requirements, applications, home inspections, grants, hurricane mitigation, matching fund grants, & priority of applications & providing appropriations.

Creates commission adjunct to DACS; provides membership & duties of commission; requires commission to submit annual report to Governor & Legislature; provides requirements for report; provides appropriation.

Provides requirements for local workforce development boards; requires DOC to develop certain training; authorizes participation in programs or courses for specified number of hours per week; authorizes DOC to suspend work requirements; requires DCF to administer exit survey; provides requirements for voluntary case management services; requires development of intake & exit surveys & survey results to be disseminated quarterly; creates School Readiness Subsidy Program within DOE; provides requirements for such program.

bill_title: Potency for Adult Personal Use of Marijuana
bill_desc: Specifies the authorized potency of tetrahydrocannabinol when consuming marijuana for personal use.

Requires APD to develop & implement electronic application process; requires agency to maintain printable paper application on its website &, upon request, provide printed paper application to an applicant; requires agency to provide applicants with specified information upon receipt of application for services; revises timeframes within which agency must make eligibility determinations for services; lowers age that caregiver must be for individual to be placed in certain preenrollment category.
Provides requirements for applicable board, or DBPR if there is no board, relating to licensure by reciprocity & by endorsement; defines "basis license."

Requires DOT to develop Strategic Infrastructure Investment Plan; provides purpose; provides requirements for development; requires plan to contain certain provisions; provides requirements for review, update, timeframe, & strategy & performance metrics of plan; requires Secretary of Transportation to submit plan & specified report biennially to Governor & Legislature; requires DOT to make annual distribution to State Transportation Trust Fund to fund projects identified in plan.

Requires certain public meetings as condition precedent to effectiveness of new or extended agreement under which municipality will provide specified utility services in other municipalities or unincorporated areas; specifies matters to be addressed in such public meetings; requires such agreements to be written; requires annual public customer meetings; limits portion of certain utility revenues that municipality may use to fund or finance general government functions; requires excess revenues to be reinvested into municipal utility or returned to customers; requires municipalities that provide specified utility services to report certain information by specified date to PSC on annual basis; requires PSC to compile certain information & submit report containing such information to Governor & Legislature by specified date; revises provisions relating to permissible rates, fees, & charges imposed by municipal water & sewer utilities on customers located outside municipal boundaries.

bill_title: Administrative Procedures Committee Review of Agency Rules
bill_desc: Requires each agency to annually compile inventory of rules by certain date; requires Administrative Procedures Committee to advise & assist agencies in preparing certain inventories & in achieving certain rule reductions; requires staff director of committee to annually prepare certain historical report by certain date; requires staff director of committee to provide report to committee, publish report in certain manner, & transmit report electronically to Legislature.

bill_title: Interception and Disclosure of Wire, Oral, or Electronic Communications
bill_desc: Permits intercept & recording of oral communication by parent of child under specified age in certain circumstances if recording is provided to law enforcement agency; permits interception & recording of oral communication in certain circumstances concerning specified offenses.

Requires covered entity to adopt policy relating to providing notice of its refused services; requires DOH to publish & maintain on its website current list of covered entities & their refused services & develop & administer public education & awareness program; revises timeframe in which physician may perform termination of pregnancy; requires AHCA to provide Medicaid reimbursement for medically necessary treatment for or related to gender dysphoria or comparable or equivalent diagnoses; prohibits AHCA from discriminating in reimbursement on basis of recipient's gender identity or that recipient is transgender individual.

Revises provisions relating to K-12 education, postsecondary education, & Education Practices Commission; establishes Purple Star School District Program; creates AA specialized transfer degrees; requires SBE to adopt rules for issuance of classical education teaching certificate.

bill_title: Access by Insureds to Claim-related Documents
bill_desc: Defines "claim-related documents"; requires insurers to notify insureds & certain parties that insureds may obtain copies of all claim-related documents upon request; requires insurers to provide to insureds, insureds' agents & attorneys, copies of all claim-related documents within specified timeframe after receiving requests; authorizes civil actions & recovery of insureds' attorney fees & costs.

bill_title: Verification of Reemployment Assistance Benefit Eligibility
bill_desc: Revises circumstances under which Department of Commerce disqualifies claimants from benefits; requires department to maintain web page & e-mail address for specified purpose & to notify employers each year of web page & e-mail address; requires department to verify claimants' identities before paying benefits; requires department to weekly cross-check certain information; requires department to procure online workforce search & match tool for specified purpose.

Prohibits courses & curriculum of teacher preparation programs, postsecondary educator preparation institutes, professional learning certification programs, & school leader preparation programs from distorting certain events & including certain curriculum & instruction; & requires teacher preparation programs, postsecondary educator preparation institutes, professional learning certification programs, & school leader preparation programs to afford candidates certain opportunities.

bill_title: Florida Hurricane Catastrophe Fund and Reinsurance Assistance
bill_desc: Revises provisions for Florida Hurricane Catastrophe Fund including, retention multiple, adjusted retention multiple, reimbursement contracts, loss adjustment expense; contract obligations; reimbursements, & reimbursement premium formula; authorizes eligible Reinsurance to Assist Policyholders program insurers to purchase RAP coverage under program; revises reimbursement under RAP program; removes provision prohibiting premiums from being charged for participation in program; revises coverage layers of Florida Optional Reinsurance Assistance program; requires transfer of specified amount from FORA Fund into Florida Hurricane Catastrophe Fund.

bill_title: Health Care Practitioner Titles and Abbreviations
bill_desc: Specifies which titles & abbreviations health care practitioners may use in their advertisements, communications, & personal identification; prohibits health care practitioners from using deceptive or misleading terms or false representations in their advertisements; requires certain health care practitioners to prominently display copy of their license in conspicuous area of their practices; provides for denial of licensure & disciplinary action.

bill_title: Affordable Housing in Counties Designated as Areas of Critical State Concern
bill_desc: Excludes land designated as area of critical state concern from county & municipality affordable housing provisions; provides for ad valorem property tax exemption of specified amount for certain property used to provide affordable housing; specifies that certain housing units may be eligible for tax exemptions if certain requirements are met; adds certain requirements to local comprehensive plans relating to hurricane evaluation study; revises powers of land authority; provides requirements for conveying affordable housing homeownership units; provides lien status prioritization for certain purposes; excludes land designated as area of critical state concern within specified time period from award requirements made to specified sponsors or persons for purpose of providing eligible housing as part of local housing assistance plan; authorizes counties that have been designated as areas of critical state concern to use tourist development tax revenue & tourist impact tax revenue for affordable housing; requires affordable housing financed with such funds to maintain its status for specified period of time; provides for distribution of such funds.

bill_title: Property Tax Exemptions for Affordable Property
bill_desc: Authorizes counties & municipalities to exempt certain accessory dwelling units from ad valorem taxation; removes requirement that certain tax exemption expire automatically.
