Removes provisions requiring DOT secretary to appoint inspector general; revises provisions relating to acceptance & processing of electronic payments to Florida Turnpike Enterprise; authorizes DOT to enter into service contracts to finance projects; prohibits DOT from considering nonpecuniary factors when developing transportation plans; creates Supply Chain Innovation Grant Program; requires DOC & DOT to consider applications & select grant awardees; requires each award made for vertiport development to be matched by nonstate funds; requires funds appropriated from State Transportation Trust Fund for New Starts Transit Program to revert to trust fund; revises provisions relating to public transit providers & vehicles.

Provides inmate transition services through reentry resource centers; specifies types of assistance that should be included; specifies process for provision of such assistance; provides goals; requires DOC to coordinate with other departments for certain purposes.
Defines "Florida financial institution."

Revises definition of "urban infill"; authorizes DEP to provide grants to CDDs for specified purposes; authorizes CDDs to submit list of proposed projects to DEP; revises definition of "modern-income persons"; requires total number of units for new developments or redevelopments to be based on plans that include certain factors; prohibits projects from requiring tax credits or bond financing; authorizes FHFC to use contributions for new construction projects to replace obsolete homes in mobile home parks or manufactured home communities; prohibits such projects from requiring tax credits or bond financing.

Requires DCF to contract with managing entities for community mobile support teams to place certain crisis counselors within local law enforcement agencies to conduct follow-up contacts with certain persons; provides requirements for crisis counselors, community mobile support teams, & certain community mental health centers.

Creates Office of Blue Economy; provides that office shall be housed within state university & administered by Board of Governors; provides duties of office; requires office to annually provide certain report to Governor & Legislature.

Removes requirements that DOH conduct examinations for clinical laboratory personnel licensure & register clinical laboratory trainees; removes requirement that Board of Clinical Laboratory Personnel approve training curricula for licensure of clinical laboratory personnel; repeals provisions relating to approval of laboratory personnel training programs; requires applicants for licensure as technologist or technician who meet specified criteria be deemed to have satisfied minimum qualifications for licensure.

Requires DOC to establish an independent incentivized prison program for nonviolent offenders; provides location requirements for program; specifies admission criteria & program requirements; provides reporting requirements.

Authorizes school districts to allow representatives of patriotic organizations certain opportunities to speak to students, distribute certain materials, & provide certain displays relating to patriotic organizations; requires certain school districts to provide date & time for such patriotic organizations to speak with students, distribute materials, & provide certain displays; authorizes patriotic organizations to be provided certain access to school buildings & properties.

bill_title: Trust Funds/Institute of Food and Agricultural Sciences Relocation and Reconstruction Trust Fund/DOE
bill_desc: Creates Institute of Food & Agricultural Sciences Renovation, Relocation, & Construction Trust Fund for specified purposes; authorizes Board of Trustees of Internal Improvement Trust Fund, at request of University of Florida Board of Trustees, to sell, trade, exchange, or otherwise dispose of specified real property & improvements; requires such funds to be deposited into trust fund for specified purposes; authorizes Board of Trustees of Internal Improvement Trust Fund, at request of University of Florida Board of Trustees, to purchase real property or improvements for specified facilities.

Exempts certain medical offices from specified supervisory relationship requirements under certain circumstances; provides that supervising physician is not required to be physically present while supervising provision of laser hair removal services by certain health care practitioners; defines term "laser hair removal."

Requires charter school to provide certain information to its sponsor to be eligible to receive capital outlay funds; provides charter school is ineligible for such funds if it fails to provide such information.

Prohibits persons from using title "state-certified doula" unless certified under specified provisions; specifies requirements for certification of doulas; prohibits entities from holding themselves out as providing specified training & education unless approved by DOH for such purpose; requires DOH to publish list of entities approved to provide training & education of doulas for certification purposes.

Prohibits solicitation or acceptance of contributions or anything of value from foreign sources of concern; requires DACS to create Honest Services Registry, publish registry on its website, & adopt rules; provides requirements for charitable organizations to be included on registry.

Revises provisions related to veterans including Florida Is For Veterans, Inc., Veterans Employment & Training Services Program, grants, workforce training & recruitment, exemption from fees, advisory council on brain & spinal cord injuries, & required instruction on Veterans' Day & Memorial Day.

Prohibits company on forced labor vendor list from taking certain procurement actions; prohibits agency from procuring commodities from certain companies for certain period; requires certain solicitations & contracts to include certain statement; requires certain contracts to include certain termination provision; requires DMS to create & maintain forced labor vendor list; provides requirements for such list; subjects company that submits false certification or that should have had certain knowledge to fine; authorizes removal of company from forced labor vendor list in certain circumstances.

bill_title: Trust Fund/Creation/Emergency Residential Property Insurance Assistance Trust Funds/DFS
bill_desc: Creates Emergency Residential Property Insurance Assistance Trust Fund within DFS; provides purpose, funding, & administration of trust fund; provides eligibility for trust fund; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

bill_title: Department of Business and Professional Regulation
bill_desc: Requires persons or entities licensed or permitted by DBPR's Division of Alcoholic Beverages & Tobacco to create & maintain account with division's online system; requires persons or entities certified or registered under Elevator Safety Act to create & maintain online account with DBPR's Division of Hotels & Restaurants; requires person seeking licensure as Florida certified public accountant, or firm seeking to engage in public accountancy, to create & maintain online account with DBPR; requires persons or entities licensed or permitted by Division of Alcoholic Beverages & Tobacco to create & maintain account with division's online system; replaces Florida Mobile Home Relocation Corporation with Division of Florida Condominiums, Timeshares, & Mobile Homes as manager & administrator of Florida Mobile Home Relocation Trust Fund.

Provides additional authority for law enforcement officers of office of inspector general concerning DOC & private corrections facilities; provides correctional privatization contracts are not exempted from state contracting provisions unless otherwise specified; removes provisions concerning development of consensus per diem rates by Prison Per-Diem Workgroup; revises provisions concerning contact with DOC by specified persons; removes provision concerning DOC control over certain funds appropriated for private correctional facilities.

Exempts certain positions from Career Service System; provides for salary & benefits for such positions to be established by DMS; revises specified requirements for certain contract managers; provides criteria for determining if vendor has its principal place of business in Florida; creates price preferences for certain bids or proposals from vendors; prohibits preference from exceeding certain percentage; requires certain disclosures; provides order of preference; removes certain preferences.
Designates Army Specialist Nicholas Panipinto Memorial Highway in Manatee County; directs DOT to erect suitable markers.

Requires hospital emergency departments to develop & implement policies and procedures, conduct training, record weights in certain manner, designate pediatric emergency care coordinator, & conduct specified assessments; requires each hospital emergency department to submit specified report to AHCA; requires AHCA to adopt rules for comprehensive emergency management plans, & in consultation with Florida Emergency Medical Services for Children State Partnership Program, establish minimum standards for pediatric patient care in hospital emergency departments.

bill_title: Child Support and Time-sharing Resulting From Unwanted Pregnancies
bill_desc: Provides requirements for prenatal care, post birth support, & time-sharing for a child under certain circumstances.

Prohibits person from operating branch of business making consumer finance loans before obtaining license from OFR; specifies application fees for branch licenses; revises maximum interest rates & calculation of interest rates on consumer finance loans; revises minimum amount of time before which delinquency charge for each payment in default may be imposed; requires licensees offering assistance program to borrowers after federally declared major disaster to send specified notice to office within certain timeframe; provides requirements for licensee claiming that submitted information contains trade secret; requires certain licensees to suspend specified actions for certain timeframe after federally declared disaster.

bill_title: Required Instruction in History of Communism
bill_desc: Beginning in specified school year, requires students to receive instruction on history of Communism; provides requirements for such instruction & school districts, & DOE; & creates Communism Education Task Force.

bill_title: Compensation for Advising or Assisting in Veterans' Benefits
bill_desc: Provides short title; provides purpose; prohibits person from receiving compensation for preparation, presentation, or prosecution of claim or advising or assisting individual with regard to veterans' benefits matter except as authorized by federal law; prohibits person from receiving compensation for referring individual to another person for such services; requires person who receives compensation for such services to be held to certain standards in rules regulating The Florida Bar; provides that violation is deceptive & unfair trade practice.
Revises provisions relating to early learning coalitions & specified early learning programs.

Revises provisions relating to certain trainings & instruction, school district procedures & requirements relating to parental notification, classroom instruction, instructional materials, school personnel training, BOG reviews, state university performance-based incentives, required instruction, DEI program, & general education core courses; repeals provisions relating to personal titles & pronouns.

Requires all persons working in roles involving direct interaction with youth to undergo mental health education & training; provides requirements for education & training; requires DCF to establish & maintain dedicated spaces easily accessible to youth for dissemination of information & resources related to mental health; provides that department, in collaboration with relative agencies, is responsible for implementation & enforcement.

Authorizes local government to enact land development regulations to permit land use for small-footprint grocery store located in food insecure area; authorizes local government to include in its comprehensive plan provision permitting land use for small-footprint grocery store located in food insecure area; authorizes local government to require mandatory reporting of information from small-footprint grocery store.

Revises provisions relating to New Worlds Scholarship Accounts, New Worlds Reading Initiative, & coordinated screening & progress monitoring system; provides grants to school districts to implement artificial intelligence for specified purposes; establishes specified tutoring program; & provides requirements for such program.

Provides nonapplicability of competitive bidding exemption; prohibits use of camera systems constructed by Chinese manufacturer; requires county or municipality to enact ordinance to authorize contract for installation of traffic infraction detectors, to consider evidence & make determination at public hearing; requires approval by governing body before contracting or renewing contract; requires report to DHSMV; prohibits compliance with certain provisions from being raised in proceeding challenging violation; provides for suspension of noncompliant county or municipality from operating traffic infraction detectors; requires DHSMV to publish certain reports on its website.

bill_title: Unauthorized Public Camping and Public Sleeping
bill_desc: Defines "public camping" & "public sleeping"; prohibits counties & municipalities from authorizing or otherwise permitting public sleeping or public camping on public property without specified permit; authorizes counties & municipalities to designate certain public property for such uses for specified time period; requires counties & municipalities to establish specified standards & procedures relating to such property; requires DCF to conduct inspections; provides exception during specified emergencies.

Revises information required to be included in sworn information form for asbestos or silica claims; specifies such form is inadmissible in evidence at trial; requires courts to dismiss certain claims upon motion by defendant; requires motions to dismiss to include certain certifications.

Proposes amendment to State Constitution to create $100,000 exemption from assessed value of real property for all levies & a $250,000 homestead exemption for residential property owned by someone 65 or older.
Requires OPPAGA to conduct a specified study & report findings by specified date.

bill_title: Property Tax Discount for Disabled Veterans
bill_desc: Proposes amendment to State Constitution to revise the requirements for a discount from the amount of ad valorem tax owed on homestead property for certain disabled veterans.

bill_title: Property Tax Discount for Disabled Veterans
bill_desc: Revises eligibility for discount on ad valorem taxation for certain disabled veterans.

bill_title: Pub. Rec./Investigations by the Department of Legal Affairs
bill_desc: Provides exemption from public records requirements for information relating to investigations by DLA of certain social media violations; authorizes DLA to disclose such information for specified purposes; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

Prohibits employment of persons younger than 21 years of age in adult entertainment establishments; requires adult entertainment establishments to check identification of entertainers; specifies forms of identification that may be used.

Requires respective boards of occupations, or DBPR if there is no board, to allow licensure by endorsement if applicant meets certain criteria; requires applicants of professions that require fingerprints for criminal history checks to submit such fingerprints before board or DBPR issues license by endorsement; requires that costs associated with fingerprint processing be borne by applicant; if fingerprints are submitted through authorized agency or vendor, requiring such agency or vendor to collect processing fees & remit them to FDLE; requires applicable health care regulatory boards, or DOH if there is no board, to issue license or certificate to applicants who meet specified conditions; requires DOH to verify certain information using National Practitioner Data Bank; specifies circumstances under which person is ineligible for license; authorizes boards or DOH to revoke license upon specified finding; authorizes boards or DOH to require that applicants successfully complete jurisprudential examination; requires DOH to submit annual report to Governor & Legislature by specified date; revises licensure by endorsement requirements for practice of acupuncture, medicine, professional or practical nursing, pharmacy, midwifery, speech-language pathology & audiology, nursing home administration, occupational therapy, radiology, respiratory therapy, dietetics & nutrition, electrology, massage therapy, opticianry, physical therapy, physical therapist assistantship, psychology & school psychology, & clinical social work, marriage & family therapy, & mental health counseling, respectively; authorizes boards & DOH to continue processing applications for licensure by endorsement, as authorized under Florida Statutes (2023), for specified timeframe.

bill_title: Reduction in Black Female and Women's Maternal Mortality Grant Program
bill_desc: Establishes Reduction In Black Female & Women's Maternal Mortality Grant Program within DOH; provides purpose & requirements for program; & provides appropriation.

Prohibits prostitution; provides for admission of certain testimony at trial; requires persons convicted of violations to attend educational program; provides program requirements; repeals provisions relating to forcing, compelling, or coercing another to become prostitute; prohibits maintaining space for commercial sex; provides enhanced penalties for certain violations; prohibits commercial sexual exploitation; deletes former provisions relating to prostitution & related acts; requires civil penalty; provides for disposition of proceeds; authorizes judicial circuits to establish educational programs for persons convicted of or charged with violations; provides program requirements; revises expunction eligibility; requires return of any fines, fees, & restitution paid by petitioner as result of conviction or convictions vacated.

Authorizes adult day care centers holding contracts with Medicaid managed care plans to provide nonemergency transportation services for their clients; provides reimbursement rates for such services; authorizes requests for waiver of continuing education requirements; provides continuing education requirements for adult date care center operators; provides required subject areas for such continuing education courses; provides compliance with continuing education requirements is condition precedent to issuance, continuation, reinstatement, & renewal of adult day care center licenses.

Redesignates "video voyeurism" as "digital voyeurism"; revises elements; provides reduced criminal penalties for certain violations by persons who are under 19 years of age; specifies that each instance of certain violations is separate offense; provides for reclassification of certain violations by certain persons who are family or household members of victim or who hold position of authority or trust with victim.

bill_title: Pub. Rec./Agency for Health Care Administration Personnel
bill_desc: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying & location information of certain current or former personnel of AHCA & names & personal identifying & location information of spouses & children of such personnel; provides for retroactive application; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

Authorizes state courts system to use state revenues, if available, to provide court-appointed interpreting services to nonindigent individuals; requires such services to be provided as prescribed by Supreme Court; removes cost recovery requirement for court-appointed interpreting services; provides exception for translation services.

Requires public schools to create School Staff Assistance for Emergencies (SAFE) Team & school elopement plan; provides requirements for such team & plan; requires creation of student-specific elopement quick reference guides for certain students; provides requirements for such guides; requires public schools to annually submit their plans to district school board.
Prohibits certain students from being suspended or expelled from K-12 school for specified actions

Provides appropriation to DOE for increased security measures at public & private historically black colleges & universities in state; requires reversion of unexpended funds; & provides for future appropriation.

Creates Florida Facilitated Retirement Program; requires certain employers to collect funds from specified employees & transfer them to accounts; requires such funds to be invested in certain accounts for specified benefit; creates Florida Facilitated Retirement Program Board.

Revises contributions & provisions for Florida Tax Credit Scholarship Program; revises provisions for Family Empowerment Scholarship Program, Hope Scholarship Program, virtual instruction program providers, private school requirements, & students in personalized education programs.

Revises criteria for person to become licensed to practice acupuncture; requires education programs for licensure renewals to be approved by Board of Acupuncture; revises continuing professional education requirements; authorizes person to practice acupuncture without license.

Encourages sharing of information relating to community grants through specified federal programs to facilitate compatibility & resiliency of community planning & activities & mission of specified military installations & ranges.
Provides that community banks have the same immunity from taxation as specified credit unions.
Urges Congress to direct U.S. Army Corps of Engineers to amend current easement policy for shore protection projects to allow such critical projects in Florida to proceed without delay.

Revises FRS Special Risk Class criteria to include members employed as 911 public safety telecommunicators; specifying number of creditable years needed to receive a full retirement benefit without penalty; requires such members to have retirement benefits calculated in accordance with provisions for Regular Class members.
Revises definition of "first responder" to include correctional officers & correctional probation officers.
Requires Legislature to appropriate revenue share payments received under 2021 gaming compact for specified purposes.

Revises procedure for adopting comprehensive plan amendments; revises duties of Florida Sports Foundation; requires Department of Commerce to establish direct-support organization; renames Florida Defense Support Task Force as direct-support organization; revises funding priority for purposes of funding grants under Incumbent Worker Training Program; specifies that certain members of state workforce development board are voting members of board; authorizes Secretary of Commerce to appoint commissioners of deeds; specifies required actions for proposed revived declaration & other governing documents.

Provides requirements for conversion of independent hospital district to nonprofit entity; requires independent entity to evaluate such conversion; requires evaluation be completed & presented to district within specified timeframe; provides for negotiation of agreement between affected county & district; provides requirements for agreement; requires disclosures; requires referendum under certain circumstances; requires district to file agreement with & provide notification to department within specified timeframe; requires independent hospital districts to conduct evaluation.

Requires supervisor of elections or political subdivision that administers election to provide language-related assistance to limited English-proficient voter; requires supervisor or political subdivision to provide election materials in covered language; requires supervisor to operate & provide public notice of assistance hotline; provides for translation services; authorizes legal actions against supervisor or political subdivision; creates Language Assistance Task Force.

Authorizes employees of DJJ & contracted providers to possess & administer opioid antagonists; provides immunity from liability for administration; replacing term "gender-specific" with "sex-specific"; eliminates minimum-risk nonresidential restrictiveness level; redesignates "nonsecure residential restrictiveness level" as "moderate-risk residential level"; revises provisions concerning transitioning child to & from secure detention care & supervised release detention care; revises provisions concerning juvenile justice circuit advisory boards.

bill_title: Taxable Income of Licensed Medical Marijuana Treatment Centers
bill_desc: Authorizes certain businesses to subtract specified deductions & credits from their taxable income.
Renaming "district advisory councils" & "school advisory councils" as "district community advisory boards" & "community advisory boards"; & revises requirements for such boards.

Requires prescription drug manufacturer permitholders to annually report certain international price data to AHCA; provides for administrative enforcement via specified fine & permit suspension; requires AHCA to contract with entity to designate reference price source countries & establish reference prices for prescription drugs based on certain criteria; requires agency contractor to weigh reference price benchmark value of such countries in two or more tiers, using specified criteria; requires agency contractor to analyze specified data to compare prices among source countries using specified exchange rate source; requires agency contractor to establish reference price for prescribed drugs or products; requires agency contractor to provide reference prices by specified date each year; requires AHCA to publish prices online within specified time; requires pharmacies to charge no more than reference price for cash-paying patients; requires certain health insurers to provide reimbursement for certain prescription drugs no higher than reference price; requires health insurers to use certain savings to offset certain payer costs; requires each health insurer to document anticipated savings & premium reductions in rate filings following availability of reference prices; requires each health insurer to assess actuarial effect of reference pricing program for each insurer product for each plan year; requires each health insurer to submit annual report on assessed effect of such program to OIR or AHCA; requires OIR & AHCA to submit joint report to Governor & Legislature; requires every health maintenance organization to comply with provisions of specified section.

Requires motor vehicle repair shop to request written crash report from customer; requires motor vehicle repair shop to prepare transaction form; requires DACS to approve such form; requires motor vehicle repair shop to maintain copy of transaction form for specified time; requires motor vehicle repair shop to deliver transaction forms to law enforcement by certain time; authorizes motor vehicle repair shop to use certain evidence in court; requires electronic transfer of transaction forms to law enforcement by motor vehicle repair shop; authorizes law enforcement to provide certain equipment to motor vehicle repair shop; specifies ownership & maintenance of equipment.

bill_title: Medical Marijuana Use Registry Identification Cards for Veterans
bill_desc: Prohibits DOH from charging a fee for the issuance, replacement, or renewal of an identification card for a service-disabled veteran under certain circumstances.
Requires DOE to establish program to provide vouchers for child care services to children within specified age range whose parents meet specified income limitation.

bill_title: Resolution of Disputed Property Insurance Claims
bill_desc: Requires, rather than authorizes, parties to property insurance claims dispute to participate in mediation; provides that mediation is condition precedent to commencing litigation; removes provisions relating to eligibility of claims for mediation; provides that parties may mutually agree to conduct mediation by teleconference or by telephone; requires all insureds, or representative thereof, to personally attend mediation; revises & specifying duties as to bearing certain costs of mediation; requires, rather than authorizing, DFS to adopt certain rules; emergency rules; requires policyholder to provide insurer with certain documents within certain timeframe after mediation is invoked; revises conditions under which policyholder has certain timeframe to rescind settlement.

Requires DOH to establish standards for environmental health technician certification; creates Andrew John Anderson Rare Pediatric Disease Grant Program; provides that any health care practitioner present at birth or responsible for primary care during neonatal period has primary responsibility of administering screenings; removes identification & screening requirements for newborns & their families for certain environmental & health risk factors; requires blood specimens for screenings of newborns be collected before specified age; revises hearing loss screening requirements for infants & toddlers; revises sickle cell disease & sickle cell trait screening requirements.
Requires county clerk of court to make certain information available in searchable database on clerk's official website.

Authorizes students earning standard high school diploma through Career & Technical Education graduation pathway option to meet certain assessment requirement by earning specified score on Mathematics Postsecondary Education Readiness Test.

Authorizes sheriffs in consolidated government, as well as all other sheriffs, to transfer funds after his or her budget is approved by board of county commissioners, city council, or budget commission; preserves independence of sheriff in consolidated government concerning certain powers.

Requires reclassification of penalty for commission of new felony committed by person who unlawfully reenters United States & while remaining unlawfully present after having been deported or removed from United States under federal immigration proceedings for committing felony, or who has departed United States while such order of deportation or removal was outstanding; authorizes reclassification of penalty for any felony or misdemeanor offenses or certain other acts or violations upon specified finding by factfinder; specifies penalty enhancement affects only applicable statutory maximum sentence; requires that findings required as basis for such sentence be found beyond reasonable doubt.

Prohibits counties & municipalities, respectively, from accepting certain ID cards or documents that are knowingly issued to individuals who are not lawfully present in United States as form of identification; provides exception.
Authorizes proceeds of tourist development tax to be used toward funding incentives for the production of films & television series by certain production companies.

Revises definition of term "foreign principal"; revises conditions under which foreign principal may purchase certain real property in state; removes provisions relating to prohibition of purchase or acquisition of real property by People's Republic of China.

bill_title: Protection of the Right to an Abortion
bill_desc: Declares that woman has protected right to an abortion; provides for civil liability for persons who violate such right; provides for punitive & compensatory damages, costs, & attorney fees; provides for state payment of awards against indigent defendants; provides for liens against indigent defendants; provides for employer liability; provides statute of limitations period.

Creates Government Technology Modernization Council within DMS; requires certain entities & persons to create safety & transparency standards for AI content or technology; requires disclosures for certain communications, interactions, & content; prohibits person or entity from producing child pornography through AI; authorizes DLA to bring action for violations under Florida Deceptive & Unfair Trade Practices Act; provides civil penalties.

bill_title: Pub. Rec./Investigations by the Department of Legal Affairs
bill_desc: Provides exemption from public records requirements for information relating to investigations by DLA of certain artificial intelligence transparency violations; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

bill_title: Grounds for Termination of Parental Rights
bill_desc: Prohibits DCF & either party to dissolution of marriage proceeding from filing petition for termination of parental rights solely because parent of child is qualified patient using medical marijuana; prohibits court from granting petition for termination of parental rights solely because parent of child is qualified patient using medical marijuana.

Revises definition of term "property insurance" to include pet insurance; requires pet insurers to provide summary of their bases or formulas for determination of claim payments under pet insurance policy on their websites or their program administrators' websites; requires pet insurers to disclose certain requirements for required medical examinations of pet by veterinarian; authorizes pet insurance applicants & policyholders to examine & return insurance policies & riders; authorizes pet insurers to issue policies that exclude coverage on basis of preexisting conditions with appropriate written disclosure to applicant or policyholder; prohibits insurance applicants' eligibility from being based on participation or lack of participation in wellness programs.

Authorizes municipalities to create community land bank programs to sell eligible real property by private sale for purposes of affordable housing & provides requirements for such programs; authorizes Florida Housing Finance Corporation to allocate tax credit among certain projects; authorizes tax credit to be transferred by recipient; creates Retail-to-residence Tax Credit Program; requires corporation to establish & adopt procedures & to prepare annual plan; requires plan to be approved by Governor; authorizes corporation to exercise certain powers; creates Affordable Housing Construction Loan Program; provides corporation with certain powers & responsibilities relating to program; provides requirements for program.

Prohibits person from operating motor vehicle while using wireless communications device in handheld manner; provides exception; requires sustained use of wireless communications device by person operating motor vehicle to be conducted through hands-free accessory until such use is terminated; provides penalties.

Revises provisions related to employee organizations, including waiving certain requirements, membership forms & dues; applications & requirements for initial registration, annual financial statements, renewal of registration, recertification, & revocation of registration & certification.

Revises provisions & establishes reporting requirements for school guardian programs & school guardians; revises school safety requirements for DOE, school districts, charter schools, & school safety specialists.

Provides requirements related to utilization review entities authorization process for accepting electronic prior authorization; provides requirements related to payment adjudicators; authorizes OIR to investigate & take appropriate actions; authorizes provider to bring private cause of action; revises requirements of insurer contracts; revises requirements for health insurers submitting claims electronically & nonelectronically; removes prohibition against waiving, voiding, or nullifying certain provisions by contract; prohibits health insurer from retrospectively denying claim; revises procedures for investigation of claims of improper billing; prohibits insurer from requiring information from provider before provision of emergency services & care.

bill_title: Automated External Defibrillators at Parks and Youth Recreation or Sports Facilities
bill_desc: Requires functioning automated external defibrillators be located on premises of specified parks & facilities; provides requirements for training & location registration of such defibrillators.

bill_title: Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Education for Athletic Coaches
bill_desc: Requires independent sanctioning authorities & Florida High School Athletic Association to adopt guidelines to educate certain persons on first aid & cardiopulmonary resuscitation procedures; requires athletic coaches to hold current certificate of successful completion of course in cardiopulmonary resuscitation.

Revising provisions related to indigent care & trauma center surtax, fees for certificates of title, license taxes, voluntary contributions, International Registration Plans, fees for driver licenses & identification cards, driver license endorsements, citrus assessments, recreational licenses & permits, court costs for criminal offenses, state park fees, fees & costs for certain firearm licenses, & tax extensions.

bill_title: Pinellas County Construction Licensing Board, Pinellas County
bill_desc: Revises board membership; revises commencement & expiration of terms; removes provisions relating to registration; removes obsolete funding & certification provisions; removes provisions requiring code compliance bond & proof of certain liability insurance as conditions for certification.

Creates North Santa Rosa County Utilities Authority & its charter; provides service area of authority; provides legislative findings; provides purposes of authority; provides for creation of interim authority; provides staffing; provides preliminary report; provides for election of governing body of authority; provides terms; provides duties & compensation; provides powers of authority; provides rate setting procedure; provides for personnel; provides personnel procedures; provides procedures for appeal of decisions of authority; provides for executive director; provides for fiscal year & budgeting; provides for execution of documents & payment of bills; provides for management efficiency audit; provides for appointment of citizens' advisory committees; provides for enforcement & penalties for violation of rules & regulations relating to operation of authority & its services.

bill_title: Pinellas Suncoast Transit Authority, Pinellas County
bill_desc: Revises definition of "public transit"; revises membership of governing body of authority; revises powers of authority; establishes requirements for advertising placed on authority property; establishes procedures for lane elimination & changes in roadway use or functionality; prohibits certain offices, boards, employees, or other actors whose purpose is to eliminate or reallocate public lanes; requires semiannual reporting of certain provisions to Pinellas Board of County Commissioners.

Creates Property Insurance Commission; provides powers & duties of commission; provides for election of Commissioner of Insurance Regulation; prohibits commissioner from engaging in certain activities or employment for specified period after leaving office; requires interest earned on insurance proceeds received by mortgagees & assignees to be paid to insureds; prohibits property insurers from claiming insolvency; authorizes persons who engage in property insurance activities in other states to engage in insurance activities in this state; prohibits property insurers from using certain defenses as claims denials; requires insurance agents to advise insurance applicants of flood risk; requires OPPAGA to conduct study of effectiveness of property insurance mediation program; increases appropriation to My Safe Florida Home Program; provides effective date.

bill_title: Pub. Rec./Investigations by the Department of Legal Affairs
bill_desc: Provides exemption from public records requirements for information relating to investigations by DLA of certain age verification violations; authorizes DLA to disclose such information for specified purposes; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.
Prohibits construction, operation, or expansion of wind energy facilities & offshore wind energy facilities in state; authorizes injunctive relief; requires DEP to adopt rules.

bill_title: Nonviolent Drug Offenders Converting Fines and Fees into Community Service
bill_desc: Specifies eligibility for certain nonviolent drug offenders to convert fines & fees into community service hours; specifies conversion rate; provides requirements for completion of community service hours.

Exempts certain applicants for medical marijuana treatment center licenses from specified licensure requirements; requires medical marijuana treatment center licenses issued to individuals be changed to reflect name of specified business entities or partnerships; provides death of applicant does not bar estate of such applicant from challenging DOH's decision on application & may not be reason to deny challenge.

Revises available sanctions for any person who is duly summoned to attend court as juror & fails to attend without any sufficient excuse; prohibits court from imposing term of imprisonment on any person who fails to attend as juror without any sufficient excuse & is found in contempt of court unless person is able to obtain legal representation.

Creates Health Care Innovation Council within DOH for specified purpose; requires council to submit annual reports to Governor & Legislature; requires department to administer revolving loan program for applicants seeking to implement certain health care innovations in this state; authorizes department to contract with third party to administer program, including loan servicing, & manage revolving loan fund.

Provides separate accounts for Citizens Property Insurance Corporation revenues, assets, liability, losses, & expenses are now maintained as Citizens account; revises requirements for certain coverages by corporation; requires inclusion of quota share primary insurance in policies; requires insurers to pay under certain circumstances producing agents certain amount or fee if agents are unable to accept appointment due to failure to be licensed as surplus lines agents; revises eligibility for commercial lines residential risks coverage by corporation; provides comparisons of comparable coverages under personal lines residential risks & commercial lines residential risks do not apply to policies that do not cover primary residences; removes provisions relating to intangibles of & coverage by Florida Windstorm Underwriting Association & corporation coastal account; revises flood coverage requirements for personal lines residential policyholders.

bill_title: Video Cameras In Public School Classrooms
bill_desc: Removes references to Video Cameras in Public School Classrooms Pilot Program; & requires district school boards to vote to establish policy to provide video cameras in self-contained classrooms upon request of parent.

bill_title: Fees to Enforce Florida Building Code
bill_desc: Provides that fees for enforcement of Florida Building Code may be used to enforce any process or enforcement relating to building permits; prohibits fees from being used for specified government activities that are not related to obtaining building permit.
Provides exemption from public records requirements for records relating to school guardians which are held by FDLE.

bill_title: Tax Exemption for Portions of Homestead Property Used as Living Quarters for Parents and Grandparents
bill_desc: Allows counties to provide assessment reduction for portions of homestead property used as living quarters for property owner's parent or grandparent who is 62 years of age or older & removes current provisions limiting reduction to increases in assessments resulting from construction or reconstruction of such living quarters & limiting amount of such reduction.

Revises requirements to receive reduction in assessed value of certain homestead properties; revises maximum value of such reduction; specifies how property is assessed when conditions are no longer met to receive such reduction.

bill_title: Liens for Professional Services of Physicians
bill_desc: Provides physician has lien for amount due for professional services; provides requirements for such lien; limits liability of certain persons; provides certain evidence is admissible at trial; specifies how funds are to be disbursed if there are multiple liens; prohibits instructions for disbursement of funds; requires specified accounting & certification to be given to lienholder; provides requirements for such certification; requires disputes to be settled before funds may be disbursed; prohibits certain liens; provides for attorney fees, costs, enforcement, & preemption.

bill_title: Damaged or Salvage Motor Vehicles, Mobile Homes, and Vessels
bill_desc: Revises provisions relating to obtaining salvage certificate of title or certificate of destruction; exempts DHSMV from liability to certain persons as result of issuance of such certificate; provides requirements for independent entity's release of damaged or dismantled vessel to owner; authorizes independent entity to apply for certain certificates for unclaimed vessel; provides application requirements; specifies provisions to which independent entity is subject; prohibits independent entity from charging vessel storage fees.

Prohibits person or entity from purposely performing or attempting to perform abortion; provides exception; provides penalties; revises requirements for court to issue order authorizing minor to consent to termination of pregnancy.

bill_title: Required Instruction in History of African Americans
bill_desc: Prohibits specified instruction & state academic standards from indicating or implying that enslaved person benefited from slavery or enslavement experience in any way.

bill_title: Deleting Punishment Clause from the Thirteenth Amendment
bill_desc: Memorial to Congress of United States, urging Congress to propose an amendment to US Constitution to delete "Punishment Clause," from Thirteenth Amendment.

Requires Division of Elections to provide certain advisory opinions upon request for certain clarification within certain period; specifies form of advisory opinion; provides that person who makes such request is deemed eligible to register to vote & to vote if division does not provide advisory opinion within specified period; requires division to issue to such person certain certification; requires certification to be mailed to person on certain day.

Revises provisions relating to driver licenses; removes provisions relating to: patient immigration status data collected by hospitals, licenses to practice law for unauthorized immigrants, employers using E-Verify, human smuggling, & sanctuary policies; requires state & political subdivisions to accept certain identification documents; revises provisions related to: person's immigration status and obtaining a professional or occupational license, law enforcement agreements with ICE, cooperation with federal immigration authorities by correctional facilities, visa applications, & children's immigration status affecting access to public schools.

bill_title: Medicaid Eligibility for Medical Assistance and Related Services
bill_desc: Extends Medicaid eligibility to specified adults.

bill_title: Climate Resilience and Drinking Water Standards
bill_desc: Requires DEP to establish Blue Communities Program & Blue Communities Fund; establishes advisory board within DEP; provides for membership; establishes Ocean State Climate Adaptation & Resilience Grant Fund within DEP; specifies sources & uses of funding & project eligibility requirements; provides duties of DEP & Florida Oceans & Coastal Council; provides reporting requirements; requires DEP & council to jointly adopt rules; establishes Marine Resources Conservation Account within Marine Resources Conservation Trust Fund to be administered by FWCC; requires DEP, or local county health department designated by DEP, to monitor level of forever chemicals in certain water systems; provides monitoring standards.

Revises policy of state regarding safe drinking water; requires DEP to adopt & implement rules for statewide maximum contaminant level for 1,4-dioxane; requires department to provide public water systems financial assistance necessary to update system infrastructure to meet certain standards; requires department to establish by rule criteria for public water system to receive such financial assistance.

Prohibits DOH from requiring enrollment in state's immunization registry or otherwise requiring persons to submit to immunizations or immunization tracking; prohibits government entity or educational entity from adopting, implementing, or enforcing specified international public health policies or guidelines unless specifically approved by the Legislature; prohibits the department from requiring, as a school-entry requirement, that children receive immunizations approved only for emergency use unless specifically approved by the Legislature.

Requires advertising platforms to collect & remit specified taxes for vacation rental transactions; adds licensing to regulated activities of public lodging establishments & public food service establishments which are preempted to state; authorizes local governments to adopt vacation rental registration programs & impose fines for failure to register; authorizes local governments to charge specified fee to inspect vacation rental & enforce certain laws; authorizes vacation rental owner to apply for registration upon sale of vacation rental premises; requires licensees to submit local vacation rental registration numbers, if applicable, to Division of Hotels and Restaurants of the DBPR through its online system; requires advertising platforms to remove ability to book advertisement or listing & to provide to division on quarterly basis list of all vacation rentals which are advertised on its platforms; authorizes division to revoke, refuse to issue or renew, or suspend vacation rental licenses; requires division to specify license number of vacation rental dwelling or unit which has been revoked or suspended; requires division's vacation rental license suspension to run concurrently with local vacation rental registration suspension.

Requires driver licenses or ID cards to have specified marking; revises registration criteria; revises required actions & required information that must be provided at registration; revises certain timeframes; revises duties of specified agencies.

Requires foreign-adversary-owned entities operating social media platforms to publicly disclose specified information in certain manner; requires foreign-adversary-owned entities operating social media platforms to implement user verification system for certain entities; requires enforcement by DLA.

Requires individual & group health insurers & HMOs to provide notice of prescription drug formulary changes within certain timeframe to current & prospective insureds & subscribers & treating physicians; specifies requirements for notice of medical necessity submitted by treating physician; specifies coverage requirement & restrictions on coverage modification by insurers & HMOs receiving notice of medical necessity; requires insurers & HMOs to maintain record of formulary changes; requires insurers & HMOs to annually submit specified report to OIR by specified date; requires office to annually compile certain data & prepare report, make report publicly accessible on its website, & submit report to Governor & Legislature by specified date; requires small employer carriers to comply with certain requirements for prescription drug formulary changes.
Revises ranking of specified child exploitation offenses for purposes of offense severity ranking chart of Criminal Punishment Code.
Revises applicability provisions for enactment or adoption of & legal challenges to county & municipal ordinances.

Revises provisions relating to medical education, public health, health care practitioners, & health care facilities to allow more access to health care services; creates the Interstate Medical Licensure Compact, the Practice of Audiology & Speech-language Pathology Compact, & the Physical Therapy Interstate Compact.

Requires each applicant for Florida State Guard to submit fingerprints to Division of State Guard or to certain vendor, entity, or agency; requires fingerprints to be forwarded to FDLE for state processing & to FBI for national criminal history record check; requires DMA, & authorizes division, to review certain results & make specified determination; requires division to bear fees for state & federal fingerprint processing & retention; specifies state cost for fingerprint processing; requires retention of fingerprints by FDLE & enrollment of fingerprints in FBI's national retained print arrest notification program; requires identified arrest record to be reported to division.

Specifies that county budget officer reports directly to board of county commissioners; prohibits such officer from being member of executive branch of county government unless otherwise authorized; specifies powers of certain county entities while acting as ex-officio budget officers; provides that any actions by such officers do not violate specified prohibitions.

Revises duties of Florida Digital Service; requires state CIO, in consultation with Secretary of Management Services, to designate state chief technology officer; requires state agency & local government to report ransomware & cybersecurity incidents within certain time periods; requires Cybersecurity Operations Center to provide notifications & reports; revises membership of Florida Cybersecurity Advisory Council; revises mission & goals of Florida Center for Cybersecurity.

Revises, creates, & repeals various provisions under jurisdiction of DEP relating to aquatic preserves; preservation & regeneration of seagrass; Southeast Florida Coral Reef Ecosystem Conservation Area; use of reclaimed water; Resilient Florida Grant Program; comprehensive statewide flood vulnerability & sea level rise data set & assessment; Statewide Flooding & Sea Level Rise Resilience Plan; regional planning councils & estuary partnerships; transfer of regulation of Onsite Sewage Program from DOH to DEP; domestic wastewater treatment facilities; & basin management action plans.

Authorizes practice of profession as substitute for certain professional or occupational degrees for foreign-trained professionals; revises education & work experience requirements for taking surveyor & mapper licensure examination.

Revises types of procedures for which medical office must register with DOH to perform office surgeries; revises standards of practice for office surgeries; specifies notification & inspection procedures for department & AHCA in event that, during reregistration process, the department determines that performance of specified procedures in office creates risk of patient safety such that office should instead be regulated as ambulatory surgical center.

Requires contractors & qualified companies that receive specified amount of money for improvements to residential real property to place such payments in escrow account; requires contractor or qualified company to provide written information within specified timeframe to owner of property; authorizes contractor or qualified company to keep funds in same account & withdraw funds; requires contractor or qualified company to provide accounting records to owner upon request; requires certain recordings be paid for by owner under certain circumstances; requires additional court cost for certain offense & provides for distribution of such cost; provides criminal penalties.

bill_title: Florida Red Tide Mitigation and Technology Development Initiative
bill_desc: Requires initiative to develop certain deployment technologies & submit report on such technologies to DEP; requires DEP to make certain determinations regarding such technologies within specified time period; provides that such technologies are deemed approved for use in specified state waters under certain circumstances.

bill_title: Qualifications for County Emergency Management Directors
bill_desc: Requiring county emergency management directors to meet specified qualifications; requiring current such directors to meet such qualifications by specified date.

bill_title: Exemption from Regulation for Bona Fide Nonprofit Organizations
bill_desc: Authorizes FSC to adopt rules prescribing criteria & processes for determining whether organization is bona fide nonprofit organization for specified purpose; provides exemptions from certain regulation for bona fide nonprofit organizations & certain employees of bona fide nonprofit organization that meet specified criteria; requires Office of Financial Regulation to make specified determination; requires office to make such determination based on terms consistent with loan origination in public or charitable context; requires office to periodically examine books & activities of organization & to revoke its status as bona fide nonprofit organization.

bill_title: Florida Keys Aqueduct Authority, Monroe County
bill_desc: Removes provision prohibiting combination of water system with sewer system within geographic boundaries of authority for purposes of financing.

bill_title: Pace Fire Rescue District, Santa Rosa County
bill_desc: Removes district's authority to levy & collect ad valorem taxes; establishes maximum rates for non-ad valorem assessments; provides exception to general law relating to initial levy of non-ad valorem assessments.

bill_title: Avalon Beach-Mulat Fire Protection District, Santa Rosa County
bill_desc: Removes district's authority to levy ad valorem taxes; establishes maximum rates for non-ad valorem assessments; provides exception to general law relating to initial levy of non-ad valorem assessments.

bill_title: Midway Fire District, Santa Rosa County
bill_desc: Removes district's authority to levy ad valorem taxes; establishes maximum rates for non-ad valorem assessments; provides exception to general law relating to initial levy of non-ad valorem assessments.

Requires Construction Industry Licensing Board within DBPR to issue registrations to eligible persons; provides that board is responsible for disciplining such licensees; requires board to make licensure & disciplinary information available through automated information system; provides for fees for issuance of registrations & renewal registrations; requires DBPR to provide license, renewal, & cancellation notices.

Requires DEP to adopt specified rules for mangrove replanting & restoration; conduct, in consultation with Division of Insurance Agent & Agency Services, statewide feasibility study regarding use of mangroves & other nature-based solutions for flood insurance purposes; & submit report to Governor & Legislature by specified date.

Creates Substance Use Disorder Housing Advisory Council; requires USF College of Public Health to assist council in conducting study to evaluate national best practice standards for specified purposes; provides for funding of study; requires council to conduct review of statewide zoning codes for specified purposes; authorizes addiction treatment services to be provided through for-profit providers; provides that certification of recovery residences that meet specified standards protects certain persons; requires certain recovery residences to keep specified records confidential; prohibits local law, ordinance, or regulation from regulating duration or frequency of resident stay at certain recovery residences.

bill_title: Tax Exemption for Communications and Internet Access Services Providers
bill_desc: Provides sales tax exemption for purchase or lease of certain equipment by communications & Internet access services providers.
Reinstates parole for offenders who solely committed certain nonviolent felony offenses.

bill_title: Driving Without a Valid Driver License
bill_desc: Revises penalties for offense of driving without valid driver license; requires specified minimum jail sentence for third or subsequent conviction of such offense.

bill_title: Medicaid Billing for Behavioral Health Services
bill_desc: Authorizes advanced practice registered nurses and physician assistants services to be billed under supervising physician's Medicaid provider under certain circumstances.

Requires DOH to develop methods to collect performance data for loan programs seeking state funding; provides requirements for such methods; requires DOH to create performance measurements based on data collected to determine eligibility of such programs for state funding.
Adds tianeptine to list of Schedule I controlled substances.

Increases maximum fine for violations of specified lobbying provisions; prohibits member of Commission on Ethics from serving more than two full terms, instead of two full terms in succession; revises and provides requirements relating to procedures & timeframes for investigation & reports of complaints or referrals of violations of Code of Ethics.
Prohibits allocation of more than certain percentage of tourist development tax revenue from individual project without a supermajority vote by a specified entity.

bill_title: Tax Rebates for Low- to Moderate-income Residents
bill_desc: Creates the Working Floridians Tax Rebate Program within DOR; grants state funds to certain people who receive specified tax credit & meet certain criteria; prohibits receipt of rebate from being used in certain program eligibility determinations.

Requires, rather than authorizes, inclusionary housing ordinances to require developers to provide specified number or percentage of affordable housing units; removes authorization for developer to contribute to housing fund or other alternatives in lieu of building affordable housing units.

Requires certain entities to notify victims of certain events; specifies victim has right to retain attorney; provides for assertion of victim's rights; revises requirements for preparation of guidelines for treatment of victims; provides policy concerning grant of delays in criminal proceedings; provides goals for completion of appellate review of convictions; provides for notice of delay with review exceeds goal; provides for reports of cases that exceed goals.

Expanding an existing exemption from public records requirements for certain information relating to crime victims & provides exemption from public records requirements for information or records that could be used to locate or harass victim or victim's family; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

Establishes Florida State Maternity Housing Grant Program within DOH; requiring the program to provide certain resources; requires department to use grant funds for specified expenses; provides limitation on amount of grants awarded under program.

Revises requirements for public housing authority self-insurance funds; specifies requirements for rate filings if certain models are used; prohibits persons from acquiring securities or ownership interests of attorneys in fact & controlling companies of attorneys in fact; requires office to suspend reciprocal certificate of authority under certain circumstances; specifies attorney in fact is deemed to be hazardous to its policyholders if reciprocal insurer is subject to suspension or revocation; prohibits domestic stock insurers from converting to reciprocal insurers; authorizes conversion of assessable reciprocal insurers to nonassessable reciprocal insurers.

Provides conditions for possession, manufacture, delivery, hold, offer for sale, distribution, or sale of hemp extract; prohibits businesses & food establishments from possessing hemp extract products that are attractive to children; prohibits DACS from granting permission to remove or use certain hemp extract products until it determines such hemp extract products comply with state law; prohibits event organizers from promoting, advertising, or facilitating certain events; requires event organizers to provide list of event participants & ensure such participants meet specified requirements; provides for administrative fines.

bill_title: Restrictions on Firearms and Ammunition During Emergencies
bill_desc: Repeals provisions relating to specified automatic restrictions on firearms & ammunition during certain declared emergencies.

Specifies manner in which hospitals may seek designation as behavioral health teaching hospital & requirements that hospital must meet to receive such designation; establishes Florida Center for Behavioral Health Workforce within Louis de la Parte Florida Mental Health Institute for specified purpose; establishes Florida Behavioral Health Professions Scholarship & Grants Program, to be administered by center; requires DCF, in coordination with Louis de la Parte Florida Mental Health Institute, to contract for two-part study of state's behavioral health system.

bill_title: Carrying and Possession of Weapons and Firearms
bill_desc: Prohibits carrying of concealed handgun or unconcealed firearm without license & possession of such handgun or firearm without valid identification; repeals provisions relating to arrests without warrant & exemption from licensing requirements for law enforcement officers; allows open carrying of any otherwise legal firearm or electric weapon or device; revises list of places into which person may not carry handgun or concealed weapon or concealed firearm; provides exceptions; deletes provisions relating to open carry, collection of fees for licenses to carry concealed weapons or concealed firearms, allowing school districts to restrict possession of firearm in vehicle, exceptions to statutory protections of right to keep & bear arms in motor vehicles, temporary ex parte risk protection orders, & eliminating liability for acts or omissions related to obtaining certain risk protection orders; provides indigent person right to counsel in risk protection proceedings; authorizes, rather than requires, court to issue risk protection order in certain circumstances; revises factors to be considered in determining whether to grant risk protection order; revises definition of "bump-fire stock."

bill_title: Unlawful Demolition of Historical Structures and Landmarks
bill_desc: Provides for enhanced fines for unlawful demolition of certain historical structures or landmarks; provides that fines may not exceed specified amount.

Requires legislative approval before Governor is authorized to renew certain emergency provisions; requires Governor to review & redraft provisions after a certain period of time; requires OPPAGA to prepare report; requires such report to accompany Governor's redraft of such provisions; provides authorized & prohibited actions of Governor; provides specified property is considered commandeered & compensation is required; provides requirements for certain emergency provisions; revises required & authorized actions of State Health Officer.

Proposes amendment to State Constitution to revise & require specified legislative procedures; provide & revise requirements for legislative officers & executive directors; provide specifications for legislative committees; revise dates & length of each legislative session; eliminate special sessions; revise when bill becomes law & takes effect; set compensation of legislative members & their staff; authorizes removal of appropriations from appropriations bills during public review period.

Requires advisory council on brain & spinal cord injuries to annually submit specified report to Governor & Legislature; authorizes State Surgeon General, in consultations with advisory council, to issue health advisory with respect to contact sports for minors; authorizes Governor, upon advice of State Surgeon General, to set minimum age for contact sports, along with reasonable waivers & exceptions.
Provides conditions under which parking lot or other parking facility in this state is exempt from mandatory minimum parking space requirements.

Revises state agency responsible for administering Municipal Solid Waste-to-Energy Program; revises requirements necessary for such facilities to be eligible to receive financial assistance grant funding; revises requirements necessary for certain municipal solid waste-to-energy facilities to be eligible to receive such funding.

Creates Nutritional Options Pilot Program within DACS for specified purpose; provides for administration of & participation in pilot program; requires participating school districts to provide alternative meals & snacks to certain students.

bill_title: Local Government Impact Fees and Exactions
bill_desc: Requires local governments that impose nonmonetary exactions to provide specified amount of compensation; places requirements on use of impact fees by local governments when collecting impact fees; requires local governments to establish impact fee zones or impact fee districts for certain purposes; limits dollar amount of impact fees that local governments may adopt, collect, or administer based on land use; prohibits local governments from adopting, collecting, or administering both impact fees & mobility fees for certain types of developments.

bill_title: Special Risk Class of Florida Retirement System
bill_desc: Authorizes employees enrolled in Special Risk Class to make election from investment plan to pension plan within certain timeframe, subject to certain conditions.

Defines "sex"; requires certain applications & licenses to indicate person's sex, rather than gender; provides requirements for health insurance policies, group health insurance policies, health benefit plans, & health maintenance contracts relating to coverage for sex-reassignment prescriptions or procedures & certain mental health & therapeutic services.
Removes provisions requiring DEP to review & update specified report; prohibits local regulation of auxiliary containers; preempts such regulation to state.

Prohibits private aircraft from landing at airport owned or operated by commercial airport authority created by Legislature as dependent special district unless certain requirements are met; authorizes airport authority to impose additional requirements for private aircraft; authorizes airport authority to require documentation that such requirements have been met.

Prohibits amendments to local government's comprehensive plan, land use map, zoning districts, or land development regulations in manner that would conflict with resiliency facility classification; requires DMS to develop Florida Humane Preferred Energy Products List; authorizes public utilities to submit to PSC petition for proposed cost recovery for certain natural gas facilities relocation costs; prohibits homeowners' association documents from precluding certain types or fuel sources of energy production & use of certain appliances; requires PSC to conduct assessment of security & resiliency of state's electric grid & natural gas facilities against physical threats & cyber threats; requires PSC to study & evaluate feasibility of advanced nuclear power technologies; requires DOT to evaluate potential development of hydrogen fueling infrastructure to support hydrogen-powered vehicles.

bill_title: Local Regulation of Nonconforming and Unsafe Structures
bill_desc: Prohibits local governments from restricting or preventing demolition of certain structures & buildings; authorizes local government to review application for demolition permit; requires replacement structures to be developed in accordance with local development regulations; provides severability; preempts certain regulation to state.

Revises timeframe for certain appeals of value adjustment board decisions; specifies when & how erroneous assessments & exemptions must be corrected; prohibiting back taxes in specified circumstances; expands types of appeals heard by the value adjustment board.

bill_title: Attorney Fees under Florida Motor Vehicle No-Fault Law
bill_desc: Provides awards of attorney fees based on judgements or decrees in lawsuits between insurers & named or omnibus insureds, or named beneficiaries, under Florida Motor Vehicle No-Fault Law.

bill_title: Duties and Prohibited Acts Associated with Death
bill_desc: Authorizes report regarding specified deaths & circumstances to be made to law enforcement agency in addition to medical examiner; increases criminal penalty for failing or refusing to report death or for refusing to make available certain information with intent to conceal death or alter evidence & circumstances surrounding death; increases criminal penalty for willfully touching, removing, or disturbing body without order from office of district medical examiner with intent to conceal death or alter evidence & circumstances surrounding death.

bill_title: Exceptional Students and Video Cameras in Public Schools
bill_desc: Revising provisions relating to exceptional student education; removes references to Video Cameras in Public School Classrooms Pilot Program.

bill_title: Criminal Offenses Against Law Enforcement Officers and Other Personnel
bill_desc: Revises provisions concerning assault or battery upon specified officers; provides for enhanced punishment for additional offenses when committed against specified officers; revises prohibition on use or threatened use of force to resist arrest or detention; revises provision concerning resisting, obstructing, or opposing specified officers.

bill_title: Location of Equipment Owned by Amusement Business Owner
bill_desc: Prohibits counties & municipalities from enacting policies, ordinances, regulations, or other measures that require payment from amusement business owner for placement, parking, or storage of equipment for longer than specified length of time on certain lands classified as agricultural lands.

Requires OFR's annual insurance reports to Governor & Legislature to include financial strength ratings of property insurers against which delinquency & similar proceedings were instituted; requires office to maintain information relating to financial strength ratings of property insurers & to make such information available upon request.

Revises the definition of "abuse"; prohibits DCF from initiating protective investigation based solely on parent's religious beliefs or ideology; requires child protective investigator to provide brief summary, verbal notification, & verbal or written summary of certain information to parents & legal custodians; provides requirements for such summaries & notification.

bill_title: Preventing Contaminants from Discharging into Wastewater Facilities and Waters of the State
bill_desc: Establishes PFAS & 1,4-dioxane pretreatment initiative within DEP for specified purpose; provides requirements for wastewater facilities with industrial pretreatment programs; provides discharge limits & surface water quality standards for industrial users; provides that such limits & standards are effective when DEP adopts rules & such rules are ratified by Legislature; requires permitting limits & ongoing sampling, reporting, & compliance standards.
Requires students awarded Florida Academic Scholars award within Florida Bright Futures Scholarship Program to receive additional funds in certain semesters for textbooks.

Requires DOS to adopt rules relating to election security; requires DOS to create certain manuals; authorizes PACs & political committees to have poll watchers; authorizes designate watchers for absentee vote processing locations; provides requirements for printed ballots & voter certificate envelopes; requires retention of materials; requires audits; provides requirements for transportation & chain of custody for ballots; revises storage, identification, and signature verification requirements; provides requirements for absentee vote processing workers; revises county canvassing board composition; authorizes removal from office of supervisor of elections; revises requirements for recounts; provides criminal penalties.
Directs DHSMV to develop Cure Diabetes license plate; provides for distribution & use of fees collected from sale of plate.

bill_title: Transportation Services for Persons with Disabilities and the Transportation Disadvantaged
bill_desc: Revises membership & duties of Commission for Transportation Disadvantaged; provides responsibilities of transportation service provider with respect to driver training, installation of video camera monitoring systems, & technology-based services; requires provider & local government to establish standards relating to reasonable time periods between request for service & arrival of provider, limitation of duration of travel times, transparency regarding quality of service provided, & system for reporting of adverse incidents; requires reports of adverse incidents to be submitted to APD; requires APD & DOT to establish requirements for investigation of adverse incidents.

Requires law enforcement officers taking custody of person for involuntary examination to seize firearms & ammunition from that person if certain criteria are met; requires law enforcement officers to request voluntary surrender of person's firearms or ammunition not already seized by law enforcement; requires law enforcement officers to petition court for risk protection order under certain circumstances after taking custody of person for involuntary examination.

bill_title: Medical Cannabis Cardholders from Other States
bill_desc: Exempts holders of medical cannabis cards from other states from provisions prohibiting bringing controlled substances into state.

bill_title: Florida African American Heritage Preservation Network
bill_desc: Requires DOS to contract with Florida African American Heritage Preservation Network for specified purpose; specifies functions that must be provided under contract; provides that certain expenses are eligible for funding under contract.

Provides moneys for annual period beginning July 1, 2024, & ending June 30, 2025, & supplemental appropriations for period ending June 30, 2024, to pay salaries & other expenses, capital outlay--buildings & other improvements, & for other specified purposes of various agencies of state government.
Implements specified appropriations of the General Appropriations Act for 2023-2024 fiscal year.
Provides for resolution pursuant to specified instructions of collective bargaining issues at impasse between state & certified representatives of bargaining units for state employees.

bill_title: Compensation of Elected Officers and Judges
